commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim support for
Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch also adds the convenience
py35 venv.

Change-Id: Ie64b63a462ae9b2c25ce9ab9e05259350353522e

subject: oooq support check, exit on anything other than CentOS and RHEL
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-28 15:41:30.000000000', 'files': ['roles/provision/support_check/meta/main.yml', 'roles/provision/defaults/main.yml', 'roles/provision/support_check/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/provision.yml'], 'message': 'oooq support check, exit on anything other than CentOS and RHEL

At the moment our oooq CI only runs on CentOS and RHEL.  To fully
support a linux distribution we need to have CI running it all the time.
This will exit the playbook with a support message if CentOS or RHEL
are not the distribution of the virthost.

Allow a user to override this check by setting
"quickstart.sh -e supported_distro_check=false"

Change-Id: I71ce50072bf8df6b0ec773e5ab69c2a27d1694a9
'}]
commit_message:
oooq support check, exit on anything other than CentOS and RHEL

At the moment our oooq CI only runs on CentOS and RHEL.  To fully
support a linux distribution we need to have CI running it all the time.
This will exit the playbook with a support message if CentOS or RHEL
are not the distribution of the virthost.

Allow a user to override this check by setting
"quickstart.sh -e supported_distro_check=false"

Change-Id: I71ce50072bf8df6b0ec773e5ab69c2a27d1694a9

commit_message:
WIP: Add grenade test for Nova simple-cells-setup migration

Currently I'm just copying the gate-grenade-dsvm-multinode and trying to
setup gate-grenade-dsvm-simple-cells-setup as an experimental job.
This is to get the job in place so we can push changes to it.

TODO: Update with configurations for the grenade cells target

Change-Id: Ifb80e3002348cc38e0dfc1048d8b8c394d460500

revisions:

Due to a recent change introduced in puppet ceilometer[1]
ceilometer auth type defaults to password type and v2
auth_url doesnt work with domain. This fixes the url to
not include suffix.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320454/

Change-Id: Ib88c3b17cb7eb11bec1e3b621fdb859834d3603a
(cherry picked from commit 7d64828ff2a05be8b0e175bcc79df21d08e4cf2a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ceilometer auth url for compute

Due to a recent change introduced in puppet ceilometer[1]
ceilometer auth type defaults to password type and v2
auth_url doesnt work with domain. This fixes the url to
not include suffix.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320454/

Change-Id: Ib88c3b17cb7eb11bec1e3b621fdb859834d3603a
(cherry picked from commit 7d64828ff2a05be8b0e175bcc79df21d08e4cf2a)

commit_message:
jsonutils.loads only if hypervisor.cpu_info is not None

This patch validate that hypervisor.cpu_info is not None
before calling jsonutils.loads(hypervisor.cpu_info)
This fixes nova hypervisor-show when compute is using
ironic driver

Closes-Bug: #1606941

Change-Id: I812efa52e58d5f8f725c3b19fb038a2c7483afd7

subject: Better handling of newton branch in osa-differ
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 14:25:46.000000000', 'files': ['osa-differ/osa-differ.py', 'osa-differ/templates/repo_details.j2'], 'message': "Better handling of newton branch in osa-differ

There was a bug in osa-differ where an exception would be thrown
if a new role appeared that didn't exist before. That's fixed in
this patch.

The script also skips the commit comparison if it notices that the
commit SHA matches between both OSA releases.

The RST output had broken headers before and those are fixed as
well.

Closes-bug: 1604840

Change-Id: Ifa47d64e7b79639a90871fdbf0370f8c425582ed
"}]
commit_message:
Better handling of newton branch in osa-differ

There was a bug in osa-differ where an exception would be thrown
if a new role appeared that didn't exist before. That's fixed in
this patch.

The script also skips the commit comparison if it notices that the
commit SHA matches between both OSA releases.

The RST output had broken headers before and those are fixed as
well.

Closes-bug: 1604840

Change-Id: Ifa47d64e7b79639a90871fdbf0370f8c425582ed

commit_message:
Use sudo for yum install

quickstart.sh is meant to be run as a non-root user, so sudo must be
used when calling yum install in install_deps.

Change-Id: I8df086153fa08a73ab118727b8d11b02dfaecd42
Closes-Bug: #1607419

subject: Allow to manually disable post-puppet restarts
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-14 14:10:54.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/post_puppet_pacemaker.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/post_puppet_pacemaker_restart.yaml', 'environments/puppet-pacemaker-no-restart.yaml', 'environments/puppet-pacemaker.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow to manually disable post-puppet restarts

Restarting services after Puppet is vital to ensure that config changes
go applied. However, it can be sometimes desirable to prevent these
restarts to avoid downtime, if the operator is sure that no config
changes need applying. This can be a case e.g. when scaling compute
nodes. Passing the puppet-pacemaker-no-restart.yaml environment file *in
addition* to puppet-pacemaker.yaml should allow this.

This is a stop gap solution before we have proper communication between
Puppet and Pacemaker to allow selective restarts.

Change-Id: I9c3c5c10ed6ecd5489a59d7e320c3c69af9e19f4
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to manually disable post-puppet restarts

Restarting services after Puppet is vital to ensure that config changes
go applied. However, it can be sometimes desirable to prevent these
restarts to avoid downtime, if the operator is sure that no config
changes need applying. This can be a case e.g. when scaling compute
nodes. Passing the puppet-pacemaker-no-restart.yaml environment file *in
addition* to puppet-pacemaker.yaml should allow this.

This is a stop gap solution before we have proper communication between
Puppet and Pacemaker to allow selective restarts.

Change-Id: I9c3c5c10ed6ecd5489a59d7e320c3c69af9e19f4

subject: Enable config-drive for tripleo-test-cloud-rh2 images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 14:30:02.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable config-drive for tripleo-test-cloud-rh2 images

Currently /mnt/config does not exists on tripleo-test-cloud-rh2
images, which is breaking glean. This patch enables support for
config-drive in nodepool.

Change-Id: Ia112a06866ffb88887896d21904ced938cfc1344
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Enable config-drive for tripleo-test-cloud-rh2 images

Currently /mnt/config does not exists on tripleo-test-cloud-rh2
images, which is breaking glean. This patch enables support for
config-drive in nodepool.

Change-Id: Ia112a06866ffb88887896d21904ced938cfc1344
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Add a second proxy-logging middleware entry to swift-proxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-13 07:02:59.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Add a second proxy-logging middleware entry to swift-proxy

Its absence results in swift using up all the memory available to it when
certain objects are requested, we are not sure exactly what triggers the
problem but we know this fixes it.

Change-Id: Iaf00a8a2a947e0683cc60fef2e75fd7c444d07a8
Closes-Bug: #1595916
(cherry picked from commit 286b8e6f06e29450da483729acb61e0a470abc5c)
'}]
commit_message:
Add a second proxy-logging middleware entry to swift-proxy

Its absence results in swift using up all the memory available to it when
certain objects are requested, we are not sure exactly what triggers the
problem but we know this fixes it.

Change-Id: Iaf00a8a2a947e0683cc60fef2e75fd7c444d07a8
Closes-Bug: #1595916
(cherry picked from commit 286b8e6f06e29450da483729acb61e0a470abc5c)

commit_message:
Add cluster table and related methods

This patch adds a new table called clusters with its ORM representation
class -Cluster-, and related DB methods.

It also updates DB tables for resources from Cinder Volume nodes that
are addressed by host to include a reference to the cluster
(cluster_name) and related DB methods.

This is part of the effort to support HA A-A in c-vol nodes.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/327283
Change-Id: I10653d4a5fe4cb3fd1f8ccf1224938451753907e
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support

commit_message:
Make Horizon get Neutron related parameters from Hiera

Current implementation of horizon class in puppet-horizon
holds well defined template for /etc/openstack_dashboard/local_settings.py
that merges default neutron options with user defined options.
Unfortunately only one user defined option "enable_distributed_router"
gets its value from hiera, so we need to add ability to configure all
available parameters using hiera.

Change-Id: Ie54eaea9dccc63bd0928ec84f9c23523b22521a2
Closes-Bug: #1591406
(cherry picked from commit 5b7e24a8eea0a6db479e85e530a554b08fa8bda2)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 17:41:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/image/glance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/image/test_glance.py'], 'message': "Don't set empty kernel_id and ramdisk_id to glance image

In some cases, if 'allow_additional_properties' option is
disabled in Glance, 'kernel_id' and 'ramdisk_id' are considered
the usual properties and cannot have None values. So it's better
always omit these props and never send them to Glance if they are
empty.

Change-Id: I3dd2a3f39d31a79c86bdbe7b656d42c20c560af3
Closes-bug: #1596602
"}]
commit_message:
Don't set empty kernel_id and ramdisk_id to glance image

In some cases, if 'allow_additional_properties' option is
disabled in Glance, 'kernel_id' and 'ramdisk_id' are considered
the usual properties and cannot have None values. So it's better
always omit these props and never send them to Glance if they are
empty.

Change-Id: I3dd2a3f39d31a79c86bdbe7b656d42c20c560af3
Closes-bug: #1596602

subject: Fix bad config defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-26 08:59:55.000000000', 'files': ['src/config.yaml', 'src/lib/charm/openstack/designate.py', 'unit_tests/test_designate_handlers.py', 'src/tests/basic_deployment.py', 'unit_tests/test_lib_charm_openstack_designate.py', 'src/reactive/designate_handlers.py', 'src/templates/mitaka/pools.yaml', 'src/templates/mitaka/designate.conf', 'src/templates/mitaka/nova_sink.cfg', 'src/templates/mitaka/neutron_sink.cfg'], 'message': "Fix bad config defaults

* Remove strings used for testing from config.yaml defaults
* neutron-* and nova-* config options are no longer compulsary. These
  are only needed for automatic generation of records when guests are
  booted or floating-ips associated. Manual management of records is
  a valid option.
* Add assess status to catch the situation where neutron-* or nova-*
  variables have been set but nameservers has not. In thios scenraio
  the domains cannot be created as there is no server defined.
* Extend amulet tests to create a server as well as domains
* 'domains' no longer resolves in sink file regex and has been
  replaces with zones
* Add missing relation for auto-generated nova records
* Rename dns-server-record config option to nameservers which is more
  consistant with upstream docs. Unused old 'nameservers' property
  needed to be removed to allow this

Change-Id: Ibd58aa8ffb3931a2fb359fad6292a9d33775a0f8
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bad config defaults

* Remove strings used for testing from config.yaml defaults
* neutron-* and nova-* config options are no longer compulsary. These
  are only needed for automatic generation of records when guests are
  booted or floating-ips associated. Manual management of records is
  a valid option.
* Add assess status to catch the situation where neutron-* or nova-*
  variables have been set but nameservers has not. In thios scenraio
  the domains cannot be created as there is no server defined.
* Extend amulet tests to create a server as well as domains
* 'domains' no longer resolves in sink file regex and has been
  replaces with zones
* Add missing relation for auto-generated nova records
* Rename dns-server-record config option to nameservers which is more
  consistant with upstream docs. Unused old 'nameservers' property
  needed to be removed to allow this

Change-Id: Ibd58aa8ffb3931a2fb359fad6292a9d33775a0f8

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-11 19:41:49.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/checks/imports.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': "Add H307 for blocking tempest import without lib

QA team defines tempest.lib as stable interfaces for using tempest code
from the other projects, and any interfaces outside of tempest.lib are
unstable:

  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/library.html#stability

However sometimes projects used the unstable interfaces, and tempest
changes affected these projects' gates.
This patch adds a rule for blocking these imports to use tempest.lib
and make projects' gates stable.

Change-Id: I4c8dcf9b1beaec4e534191f9e70e5bbc529c69e2
"}]
commit_message:
Add H307 for blocking tempest import without lib

QA team defines tempest.lib as stable interfaces for using tempest code
from the other projects, and any interfaces outside of tempest.lib are
unstable:

  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/library.html#stability

However sometimes projects used the unstable interfaces, and tempest
changes affected these projects' gates.
This patch adds a rule for blocking these imports to use tempest.lib
and make projects' gates stable.

Change-Id: I4c8dcf9b1beaec4e534191f9e70e5bbc529c69e2

commit_message:
Implement nova::cache in stable/mitaka

nova::cache class was implemented during Newton but Nova deprecated
memcached_servers option during Mitaka and suggested to use [cache]
options [1]. This class implements nova::cache class without using
puppet-oslo, but the results are the same as we did in Newton.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/mitaka.html

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 13:59:20.000000000', 'files': ['charms_openstack/adapters.py', 'unit_tests/test_charms_openstack_adapters.py'], 'message': 'Ensure internal_addresses exists for single units

Change-Id: I974477454d14c539d5e3702fa32f76caa49dfae6
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure internal_addresses exists for single units

When a single unit of an application creates its adapters the cluster
namespace is populated with the dict passed back by single_node_map.
This is currently missing the internal_addresses information which
a unit with peers has access to.

Change-Id: I974477454d14c539d5e3702fa32f76caa49dfae6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 15:08:50.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/mysql-wss'], 'message': 'Stop looking for master once latest seqno found

This change updates how we look for a master by stopping once we have
found a service with the largest seqno. Previously if all servers
had the same seqno then we would return the last server as a master
rather than the first. This had the side effect that during bootstrap
when the first server was the original master, it would be demoted for
each new server that was added to the group.  This should prevent the
ocf script from shuffling masters if they have the same seqno. We will
always pick the first server rather than the last.

Change-Id: Iacbd2e2ec403985a1ff52880669b1bec62dbbaba
Closes-Bug: #1592401
Related-Bug: #1592819
(cherry picked from commit 26f1690d10a5c8f401033dff00166c14bf77d4ac)
'}]
commit_message:
Stop looking for master once latest seqno found

This change updates how we look for a master by stopping once we have
found a service with the largest seqno. Previously if all servers
had the same seqno then we would return the last server as a master
rather than the first. This had the side effect that during bootstrap
when the first server was the original master, it would be demoted for
each new server that was added to the group.  This should prevent the
ocf script from shuffling masters if they have the same seqno. We will
always pick the first server rather than the last.

Change-Id: Iacbd2e2ec403985a1ff52880669b1bec62dbbaba
Closes-Bug: #1592401
Related-Bug: #1592819
(cherry picked from commit 26f1690d10a5c8f401033dff00166c14bf77d4ac)

to be automatically completed by the client browser.  Defaults to
'off' to maintain backwards compatibility with previous releases.

commit_message:
improve task distribution

let a single process gather metrics to process. it will then pipe
the metrics to a queue and all the workers will grab a chunk.

this better distributes tasks to avoid overlap between workers and
also minimises the load on backend where previously all the workers
queried backend for jobs.

Change-Id: I75c9091f09272bccbd859996e4d1745eadf8c329

commit_message:
test: fix race condition in update testing

The archive policy used to test the update mechanism was the "low" one,
which is used by a lot of different test in parallel. So modifying it
might make these tests fail. Create a temporary archive policy for this
test.

Change-Id: I28bb882855a04526faab1710519f613c5f194de3

Neutron will raise a forbidden exception when the neutron policy is not
allowed to for some operation like create_port. The operation is an RPC
call from nova-api to nova-compute. The Forbidden from neutron isn't
handled in nova-api so we get a 500 back instead of a 403. It should be
a 403 in this case.

Change-Id: Iea4feaeb7ea6860e892ef57a4443e814a74b1d9e
Closes-bug: #1603592
"}]
commit_message:
network: handle forbidden exception from neutron

Neutron will raise a forbidden exception when the neutron policy is not
allowed to for some operation like create_port. The operation is an RPC
call from nova-api to nova-compute. The Forbidden from neutron isn't
handled in nova-api so we get a 500 back instead of a 403. It should be
a 403 in this case.

Change-Id: Iea4feaeb7ea6860e892ef57a4443e814a74b1d9e
Closes-bug: #1603592

subject: tests: extend the test timeout to 120s for migration sync testing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 11:19:42.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/indexer/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py'], 'message': 'tests: extend the test timeout to 120s for migration sync testing

MySQL is long to inspect, and usually take up to more than 60s on slow
system, which is the default value for OS_TEST_TIMEOUT. This extends it
to 120s so we avoid random test failure.

Change-Id: I1b207b3ec2f04bba6ef8b397c3822e462fde4332
'}]
commit_message:
tests: extend the test timeout to 120s for migration sync testing

MySQL is long to inspect, and usually take up to more than 60s on slow
system, which is the default value for OS_TEST_TIMEOUT. This extends it
to 120s so we avoid random test failure.

Change-Id: I1b207b3ec2f04bba6ef8b397c3822e462fde4332

commit_message:
Update expected postfix logs

With the locking down of postfix, we no longer may end up with local
mail messages. We should only look for the main postfix logs as the
others will not be present if no messages are being sent.

Change-Id: I36e74ebe66d1ee3b70336f83b74f18d189b6c477
Closes-Bug: #1606900
Related-Bug: #1603916

subject: Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 12:36:41.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/tests/unit/test_session.py'], 'message': 'Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented by
using != operator to compare two dicts. So is
assertEqual() in testtools. assertEqual() in
testtools is able to handle dict, list, set and so
on. So we just call assertEqual() to make the unit
tests simpler.

Change-Id: Id90d1445053f295d36d52bf95794847ed524087d
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented by
using != operator to compare two dicts. So is
assertEqual() in testtools. assertEqual() in
testtools is able to handle dict, list, set and so
on. So we just call assertEqual() to make the unit
tests simpler.

Change-Id: Id90d1445053f295d36d52bf95794847ed524087d

subject: Changes freezer-agent consistency switches to hyphens/dashes
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-28 12:32:30.000000000', 'files': ['freezer/common/config.py'], 'message': "Changes freezer-agent consistency switches to hyphens/dashes

Freezer-agent's command line switches for consistency checks:

* --[no]consistency_check
* --consistency_checksum

use underscores where no other (non-deprecated) switches in
freezer-agent do - they all use hyphens/dashes (-) instead.
Fixing that for consistency and leaving the underscored
versions as deprecated names so that they still work for now.

Change-Id: I410f21fed1ec64831b265ddc35073453c4f0c31c
Closes-Bug: #1603028
"}]
commit_message:
Changes freezer-agent consistency switches to hyphens/dashes

Freezer-agent's command line switches for consistency checks:

* --[no]consistency_check
* --consistency_checksum

use underscores where no other (non-deprecated) switches in
freezer-agent do - they all use hyphens/dashes (-) instead.
Fixing that for consistency and leaving the underscored
versions as deprecated names so that they still work for now.

Change-Id: I410f21fed1ec64831b265ddc35073453c4f0c31c
Closes-Bug: #1603028

commit_message:
Bring models in sync with migrations, add test

Bring the sqlalchemy models in sync with the alembic migrations.

Add the neutron standard model-migration sync test. The test is
added to the unit test env since bgpvpn does not have a
functional job yet. This requires that bgpvpn uses the
python-db-jobs template in the gate.

The neutron HasTenant model mixin includes an index for the
tenant_id column, but bgpvpn's alembic migrations never created
those indexes. So here we include a migration to add them.

(Also clean up some unused parameters and __init__ files.)

Closes-Bug: #1605608
Partial-Bug: #1604803

Depends-On: I3a8ea02b86846e9a8a7d7f2aee9700ca952b0248

Change-Id: I24d35f7dccab611143f4b0a7428ba7074f2adcc2

commit_message:
Revise test_metadata_checksum

This updates test_metadata_checksum to take advantage of the new
backup creation utilities in BaseFreezerTest. Additionally, this
removes a workaround that was obscuring a bug in the consistency check
code where binary files could not be checked correctly due to encoding
errors.

Change-Id: I16131af67a50706c1238ce7af71960fdf956514e

commit_message:
Clean tempest dir before cloning.

This ensures that the code is recloned and if a venv is used, it is
unpacked into a clean clone. If a venv is unpacked multiple times (eg
multiple runs of the playbook) into the same dir then that venv may
become inconsistent.

This is a minimal fix for liberty as the full patch didn't backport
cleanly.

Bug: #1592509
Change-Id: I6f3c36a8150b83afabae8d397d5fc7340dbc93fd
Related-to: 13edcc092597b7109d0f75435ab4d07d56149998

Move the flag --template to UpgradeEnvCommand

The flag --template was returned
from UpgradeNodeCommand to UpgradeEnvCommand,
because the problem with assigning node to cluster
with network template is resolved

commit_message:
Created jobs for nodejs version 6

This patch creates two job groups for nodejs6, as well as job
templates for the same. They follow the exact same pattern as
nodejs version 4 templates, to simplify creating an upgrade path.

These jobs have been set to non-voting, and have been added to
the js-openstack-lib project.

Change-Id: I16f6021d5c713153b505560e47c4783cdee314f9

commit_message:
Preserve new environment row from sorting with other rows

New environment row is now appended to table head instead of
prepending it to body. It allows this row to stay on the top while
sorting rows.
Also this row is now not checked for the status change while
triggering page reload.

Change-Id: I91ae1edeed427dda0a1540c7bee715832b172c3f
Closes-bug: #1593366
Closes-bug: #1606896

subject: Refactoring of the ObjectStore passing in DSL
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-27 02:32:18.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/type_scheme.py', 'murano/dsl/meta.py', 'murano/dsl/reflection.py', 'murano/tests/unit/policy/modify/actions/test_action_manager.py', 'murano/common/engine.py', 'murano/cmd/test_runner.py', 'murano/dsl/yaql_functions.py', 'murano/dsl/constants.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_package.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_agent.py', 'murano/engine/mock_context_manager.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_property.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_method.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_object.py', 'murano/dsl/object_store.py', 'murano/tests/unit/policy/modify/actions/test_default_actions.py', 'murano/dsl/typespec.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_type.py', 'murano/dsl/helpers.py', 'murano/dsl/dsl.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/foundation/runner.py', 'murano/dsl/principal_objects/sys_object.py', 'murano/dsl/yaql_integration.py', 'murano/dsl/executor.py', 'murano/dsl/serializer.py', 'murano/dsl/principal_objects/stack_trace.py'], 'message': 'Refactoring of the ObjectStore passing in DSL

ObjectStore is a container for all of the objects that are either
loaded from object model or created at runtime. Thus ObjectStore
instance is required in order to either use new() function or use
class() contract with object model snippet.

In current implementation each object had a object_store property
that was pointing to the ObjectStore instance used to create it (the
one that has the object). In order to create new object an ObjectStore
of the $this object was used for that purpose. This approach caused
several issues:
* There is no $this object in static methods and thus no way to obtain
   current ObjectStore
* Objects are bind to their stores so temporary ObjectStore instances
  cannot be used to load object graphs

 This refactoring moves ObjectStore instances to the thread-local attribute.
 Thus there is always a "current" ObjectStore.

 Also because ObjectStore has a reference to the MuranoDslExecutor instance
 it becomes possible to get current executor and everything else that it contains
 (current execution session, attribute store, package loader) from the local
 thread storage without passing it in the hidden context variables.

Change-Id: I19a08b391486c1ae1b98ca559c8d3fafaca6e1ef
'}]
commit_message:
Refactoring of the ObjectStore passing in DSL

ObjectStore is a container for all of the objects that are either
loaded from object model or created at runtime. Thus ObjectStore
instance is required in order to either use new() function or use
class() contract with object model snippet.

In current implementation each object had a object_store property
that was pointing to the ObjectStore instance used to create it (the
one that has the object). In order to create new object an ObjectStore
of the $this object was used for that purpose. This approach caused
several issues:
* There is no $this object in static methods and thus no way to obtain
   current ObjectStore
* Objects are bind to their stores so temporary ObjectStore instances
  cannot be used to load object graphs

 This refactoring moves ObjectStore instances to the thread-local attribute.
 Thus there is always a "current" ObjectStore.

 Also because ObjectStore has a reference to the MuranoDslExecutor instance
 it becomes possible to get current executor and everything else that it contains
 (current execution session, attribute store, package loader) from the local
 thread storage without passing it in the hidden context variables.

Change-Id: I19a08b391486c1ae1b98ca559c8d3fafaca6e1ef

commit_message:
Add job to build generic debian packages

Now that openstack-pkg-tools is built and publish, this job uses it
to build other packages.

To actually test this job, this patch also adds the deb-spice-html5
package, which is a very trivial package with no dependency, in order
to test building with this patch. I'm not sure it really is needed
to maintain the spice-html5 package on Gerrit, so this may be just
temporary. Other Git repositories for all of the other packages will
be added once this package builds fine and is published.

Also, as the Jessie image doesn't contain the debian-openstack repo
yet, we add it to the sources.list. This will be able to go away
next week, according to pabelanger.

Change-Id: I15660191360ed68fb1fb5a3a4170ad2353336ebf
Needed-By: I1188b90b3d2039f712fb1efda69e2a6157621079

commit_message:
Add location_strategy.metadata_weight

Allows sorting of locations by a weight key defined in metadata.
Locations with a higher weight will be returned first. Locations with no
weight key will be returned in original order.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1528453

Co-Authored-By: Fei Long Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>

Change-Id: I4cbb9d0ee4779619b478c1bc5186646c44f24191

commit_message:
Replace node.create() with node.start() in warm_start_nodes

With the introduction of IpmiNode it's better to use node.start()
method, because node.create() works only for virtual slaves

Also:
+ add configurable timeout to the warm and cold restart methods

Change-Id: I4968d62c2b431271928b55672431422cb5527f7a
Closes-Bug: #1603351
(cherry picked from commit 643bf76c6a53e8093adff66675115081e9c8a17d)

subject: If /var/log/lxc exists, move it to the log aggregation parent
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-25 23:47:20.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/lxc-hosts-setup.yml'], 'message': 'If /var/log/lxc exists, move it to the log aggregation parent

In https://review.openstack.org/344721 the log aggregation link
was added for lxc logs to ensure that the logs are collected
in a central place.

This patch ensures that any pre-existing folder (which may exist
due to the playbook being run when upgrading) is moved to the

Change-Id: I35a9b3176a79caf9cee177442fa6b3d79e057ea9
'}]
commit_message:
If /var/log/lxc exists, move it to the log aggregation parent

In https://review.openstack.org/344721 the log aggregation link
was added for lxc logs to ensure that the logs are collected
in a central place.

This patch ensures that any pre-existing folder (which may exist
due to the playbook being run when upgrading) is moved to the
right place. This ensures that previous logs are kept and that
upgrades execute without failure.

Change-Id: I35a9b3176a79caf9cee177442fa6b3d79e057ea9

subject: Allow container bind mounts to be set in group/host vars
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-28 12:57:43.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-containers-functional.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/container-bind-mounts-1a3a763178255841.yaml', 'tests/host_vars/container2.yml', 'tasks/container_create.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Allow container bind mounts to be set in group/host vars

To reduce the number of times a container is restarted during the
build process, this patch implements the facility to consume
LXC bind mounts items from the inventory.

This allows bind mounts to be set in group_vars and therefore have
them applied on container creation instead of later when the service
install playbook runs.

Previously the container_commands option was used, but the bind
mounts are a special case which are better served with its own
set of tasks to ensure that everything needed is in place on the
host and in the container.

Needed-By: Ie2a0528fbd56c8360dd679f55fb2047e0a061c31
Change-Id: I72cdc607d7b4364d78c840bf688e43e013f40709
'}]
commit_message:
Allow container bind mounts to be set in group/host vars

To reduce the number of times a container is restarted during the
build process, this patch implements the facility to consume
LXC bind mounts items from the inventory.

This allows bind mounts to be set in group_vars and therefore have
them applied on container creation instead of later when the service
install playbook runs.

Previously the container_commands option was used, but the bind
mounts are a special case which are better served with its own
set of tasks to ensure that everything needed is in place on the
host and in the container.

Needed-By: Ie2a0528fbd56c8360dd679f55fb2047e0a061c31
Change-Id: I72cdc607d7b4364d78c840bf688e43e013f40709

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 18338, 'name': 'Ron De Rose', 'email': 'ronald.de.rose@intel.com', 'username': 'derosenet'}, {'_account_id': 18462, 'name': 'Rahul U Nair', 'email': 'rahulunair@gmail.com', 'username': 'rahulunair'}, {'_account_id': 19985, 'name': 'Ryosuke Mizuno', 'email': 'r-mizuno@rs.jp.nec.com', 'username': 'r-mizuno'}, {'_account_id': 21465, 'name': 'Mikhail Nikolaenko', 'email': 'mnikolaenko@protonmail.com', 'username': 'mnikolaenko'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-27 05:20:50.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py'], 'message': 'Invalid tls_req_cert constant as default

There are several occurances where the argument default of
tls_req_cert is set to 'demand'. This is an invalid option for the
function _common_ldap_initialization, which expects one of the values
of the dict LDAP_TLS_CERTS, not a key.

If tls_req_cert='demand' is given to _common_ldap_initialization,
you'll get:
   "LDAP TLS: invalid TLS_REQUIRE_CERT Option=demand"

Change-Id: I2da2c041bac25ca7ebab8c32b464164279a6bd69
'}]
commit_message:
Invalid tls_req_cert constant as default

There are several occurances where the argument default of
tls_req_cert is set to 'demand'. This is an invalid option for the
function _common_ldap_initialization, which expects one of the values
of the dict LDAP_TLS_CERTS, not a key.

If tls_req_cert='demand' is given to _common_ldap_initialization,
you'll get:
   "LDAP TLS: invalid TLS_REQUIRE_CERT Option=demand"

Change-Id: I2da2c041bac25ca7ebab8c32b464164279a6bd69

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-27 05:32:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Skip DHCP provisioning block for network ports

Network ports created via internal core plugin calls
(e.g. dhcp ports and router interfaces) don't generate
DHCP notifications to the DHCP agent so the agent never
clears the DHCP provisioning block. This patch just skips
adding DHCP provisioning blocks for network owned ports
since they don't depend on DHCP anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1590845
Closes-Bug: #1605955
Change-Id: I0111de79d9259ada3b1c06a087d0eaeb8f3cb158
"}]
commit_message:
Skip DHCP provisioning block for network ports

Network ports created via internal core plugin calls
(e.g. dhcp ports and router interfaces) don't generate
DHCP notifications to the DHCP agent so the agent never
clears the DHCP provisioning block. This patch just skips
adding DHCP provisioning blocks for network owned ports
since they don't depend on DHCP anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1590845
Closes-Bug: #1605955
Change-Id: I0111de79d9259ada3b1c06a087d0eaeb8f3cb158

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 11:52:43.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/os-refresh-config/configure.d/50-puppet-stack-config'], 'message': 'Explicitly set $FACTER_fqdn

Instead of letting puppet figure out the fqdn, tell it the right value
to use.  This will hopefully fix issues where puppet has detected a
different fqdn than has actually been configured resulting in errors
similar to:

Could not run: Could not retrieve facts for localhost.localhost: no
address for localhost.localhost

Change-Id: I158766b711fbdfb907f5b3aeb8ad4d0e47570fe3
Partial-Bug: #1607334
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set $FACTER_fqdn

Instead of letting puppet figure out the fqdn, tell it the right value
to use.  This will hopefully fix issues where puppet has detected a
different fqdn than has actually been configured resulting in errors
similar to:

Could not run: Could not retrieve facts for localhost.localhost: no
address for localhost.localhost

Change-Id: I158766b711fbdfb907f5b3aeb8ad4d0e47570fe3
Partial-Bug: #1607334

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 20:39:13.000000000', 'files': ['microversion_parse/__init__.py', 'microversion_parse/tests/test_webob.py', 'microversion_parse/tests/test_get_version.py'], 'message': "Convert dict headers and Webob headers into lowercases.

In the fold_headers function, if the headers behaves like a dict,
return it. So the headers don't get to change to lowercase that can
not be parsed correctly.

Convert these headers to lowercases also provide a test cse to validate
the header is being parsed correctly.

Close-Bug:# 1606351

Install Gerrit its-storyboard plugin[1] to support integration between

Changing to lowercase if the headers behave like dict is needed.

Change-Id: I9bfed908df5697ead02ed1f1e8d4c55bfc6e2855
"}]
commit_message:
Convert dict headers and Webob headers into lowercases.

In the fold_headers function, if the headers behaves like a dict,
return it. So the headers don't get to change to lowercase that can
not be parsed correctly.

Convert these headers to lowercases also provide a test cse to validate
the header is being parsed correctly.

Close-Bug:# 1606351

Install Gerrit its-storyboard plugin[1] to support integration between

Changing to lowercase if the headers behave like dict is needed.

Change-Id: I9bfed908df5697ead02ed1f1e8d4c55bfc6e2855

Limit the SQL query number when loading the synthetic fields for Neutron
DB objects. If synthetic fields is defined in SQL model as orm.relationship,
the objects are loaded with main object. No need to query for those resources
once more.

It has impact on performance in scale, to have constant number of SQL queries
when number of resources stored in DB is increasing.

Change-Id: Ie54d9f51642edec1f4533062eb8306b78a1b6f20
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
'}]
commit_message:
objects: loading synthetic fields from defined ORM relationships.

Limit the SQL query number when loading the synthetic fields for Neutron
DB objects. If synthetic fields is defined in SQL model as orm.relationship,
the objects are loaded with main object. No need to query for those resources
once more.

It has impact on performance in scale, to have constant number of SQL queries
when number of resources stored in DB is increasing.

Change-Id: Ie54d9f51642edec1f4533062eb8306b78a1b6f20
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

subject: Restore telemetry service deployment
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-07-27 20:05:30.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml'], 'message': 'Restore telemetry service deployment

In https://review.openstack.org/344345 the telemetry deployment was
removed in order to reduce the deployment time, thus improving the
chance of success for the commit.

This patch restores the telemetry service deployment. In order to
do that, new values are needed to address undefined new variables in
the ceilometer role.

commit_message:
Restore telemetry service deployment

In https://review.openstack.org/344345 the telemetry deployment was
removed in order to reduce the deployment time, thus improving the
chance of success for the commit.

This patch restores the telemetry service deployment. In order to
do that, new values are needed to address undefined new variables in
the ceilometer role.

Change-Id: I4d6323b3f57a67f1189d79e01aedee267f496b7c

subject: Fix CI status report to show all job results on 1 line
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 20775, 'name': 'Carlos Camacho', 'email': 'ccamacho@redhat.com', 'username': 'ccamacho'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-28 01:22:17.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo-jobs-gerrit.py'], 'message': 'Fix CI status report to show all job results on 1 line

When we added the multinode job to the CI status report, we introduced a
bug whereby the job results for the same patchset were split across
multiple lines in the report.

The bug was due to the fact that the script assumes that all of the CI
results were in a single comment from Jenkins in the review. With the
addition of the multinode job, this is no longer true: we have to parse
multiple comments.

The patch changes the building of the results dictionary to update it's
data (using setdefault) to support parsing of multiple comments and keys
by review id and patchset instead of timestamp.

The ci_results dict in each value of the results dict should now be a
union of the CI results from all the latest comments that contain the
job names we are checking.

During the html generation, we still want to sort by timestamp, so we
need to introspect the values of the "data" dict instead of just sorting
by its keys.

Change-Id: I8df41877ea274170f7466bf35cb040c46dea58d2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix CI status report to show all job results on 1 line

When we added the multinode job to the CI status report, we introduced a
bug whereby the job results for the same patchset were split across
multiple lines in the report.

The bug was due to the fact that the script assumes that all of the CI
results were in a single comment from Jenkins in the review. With the
addition of the multinode job, this is no longer true: we have to parse
multiple comments.

The patch changes the building of the results dictionary to update it's
data (using setdefault) to support parsing of multiple comments and keys
by review id and patchset instead of timestamp.

The ci_results dict in each value of the results dict should now be a
union of the CI results from all the latest comments that contain the
job names we are checking.

During the html generation, we still want to sort by timestamp, so we
need to introspect the values of the "data" dict instead of just sorting
by its keys.

Change-Id: I8df41877ea274170f7466bf35cb040c46dea58d2

commit_message:
No need the redundant validation in manager level

Alone with the enabling of schema validation for V2 API, the property
validation has been handled in controller level, property validation
based on clean.py in manager level is no long needed for creating a
project since schema validation is enabled for both V2 and V3.

The patch removes the call from `clean.py` and remove the relevant
testcases since we already have the testcases both in
`test_validation.py` or `test_v2_validation.py`.

Partially implements: bp schema-validation-extent

Change-Id: I9d2ea60d496d83372109ca227ee2091850de0213

commit_message:
Fix overcloud pingtest for stable branches

The backwards compatible translated version of
`openstack stack show` does not return a table, so
there is no "value" to grep for.

Instead we can use cliff magic to get what we want
in the untranslated command, so that the translated
command 'just works'.

Change-Id: I960c07b9ca7b1c4b9083dcb5029a33d80da4585a
Closes-Bug: 1577903

subject: Support Linux-IO in addition to tgtd
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-23 12:07:09.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/extensions/iscsi.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/extensions/test_image.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/extensions/test_iscsi.py', 'ironic_python_agent/extensions/image.py', 'ironic_python_agent/errors.py'], 'message': 'Support Linux-IO in addition to tgtd

There is no support for tgt in CentOS. The package is in
EPEL, but for the RDO distribution, we are not using EPEL
in order to more tightly control what packages are in our
releases.

This means we can not switch to the IPA ramdisk for deploy
for the Liberty release. However, the bash deploy ramdisk
is also not a good solution, as it is deprecated.

It should be considered a bug that IPA does not work with
the natively supported iSCSI implementation in CentOS,
hence backporting these patches to Liberty should be ok.

The iSCSI extension now tries to use Linux-IO first (via rtslib)
and falls back to tgtd if Linux-IO can't be used (e.g. in the CoreOS-based
image which uses containers).

This also includes the follow-up fix:

Delete the Linux-IO target before setting up local boot

Otherwise it fails with "device already mounted".

Additionally, the import of rtslib is made to fail
transparently. This way we do not add additional
requirements for those happily using tgt based iSCSI
on stable/liberty.

Change-Id: I9cc7a30d9c93c445a66d183146e9260c2b096d33
Closes-Bug: #1551250
(cherry picked from commit c474a5ac6c8483a8811c58e28fb6c152b5ab755d)
(cherry picked from commit 4cd64e28aa24e91534800288ab1c60407b4a722f)
'}]
commit_message:
Support Linux-IO in addition to tgtd

There is no support for tgt in CentOS. The package is in
EPEL, but for the RDO distribution, we are not using EPEL
in order to more tightly control what packages are in our
releases.

This means we can not switch to the IPA ramdisk for deploy
for the Liberty release. However, the bash deploy ramdisk
is also not a good solution, as it is deprecated.

It should be considered a bug that IPA does not work with
the natively supported iSCSI implementation in CentOS,
hence backporting these patches to Liberty should be ok.

The iSCSI extension now tries to use Linux-IO first (via rtslib)
and falls back to tgtd if Linux-IO can't be used (e.g. in the CoreOS-based
image which uses containers).

This also includes the follow-up fix:

Delete the Linux-IO target before setting up local boot

Otherwise it fails with "device already mounted".

Additionally, the import of rtslib is made to fail
transparently. This way we do not add additional
requirements for those happily using tgt based iSCSI
on stable/liberty.

Change-Id: I9cc7a30d9c93c445a66d183146e9260c2b096d33
Closes-Bug: #1551250
(cherry picked from commit c474a5ac6c8483a8811c58e28fb6c152b5ab755d)
(cherry picked from commit 4cd64e28aa24e91534800288ab1c60407b4a722f)

commit_message:
Update current repo setup includepkgs

The tripleo-common package was renamed to openstack-tripleo-common.
It has a provides for backwards compatibility, but includepkgs does
not look at provides. As a result, we were getting tripleo-common
from the pinned repo instead of the current repo.

Change-Id: I26b348ec585a50644631ba87b6b9276827cb80d7

commit_message:
Python 3: dict.itervalues()

Replace dict.itervalues() with dict.values(). The Python 3 dict
type has no itervalues() method, the old itervalues() method was
renamed to values().

TrivialFix.

Change-Id: I5d96f26db2bb3490271962d9548672cfdd03357e

commit_message:
Add the missing testcases for `name` and `enabled`

- `bool`, `int`, whitespace are not valid name.
- The valid data type for `enabled` is `bool`, other type such as
 `string`, `int` are invalid.

This change fix the gap between testcases in manager level and
testcases in `test_v2_validation.py` so that we can clean up the
testcases validated by clean.py in the follow up.

Partially implements: bp schema-validation-extent

Change-Id: Ifade298b9dafe7df3380c16de0a6fac4f941e9c3

commit_message:
Remove global openstack-core resource

The openstack-core resource is not needed by the NG Pacemaker
architecture. It was moved into an isolated role by [1] so that
it could optionally be enabled when wanting the older architecture.

This submission removes the old openstack-core global resource.

1. I74a62973146c0261385ecf5fd3d06db51e079caa

commit_message:
client_id regex now permits valid fqdn for hostname

The regular expression that was sanity checking client_id
for jobs being submitted to the freezer API wasn't
permitting fully qualified domain names (fqdns) to be
supplied (which it should) so the regex has been updated
to allow this.

(cherry picked from commit 10ec5e30da67f67601cc58fd5485d6882e95511e)

Conflicts:
	freezer_api/tests/freezer_api_tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_api_jobs.py

Closes-Bug: #1570377

Currently, there is a boolean in the configuration file called
*use_floating_ips* which conflates the logic around the existence of floating
ips for instances and the use of floating ips for management by sahara.

commit_message:
Refactor the logic around use of floating ips

Currently, there is a boolean in the configuration file called
*use_floating_ips* which conflates the logic around the existence of floating
ips for instances and the use of floating ips for management by sahara.
This logic should be refactored for node groups and cluster.

Related blueprint: refactor-use-floating-ip

Change-Id: I3c14ff6e5939342fd9f52de4984ca35da060d46a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-28 05:03:04.000000000', 'files': ['ext/openstack_deploy/user_gnocchi_overrides.yml.example', 'README.rst', 'ext/openstack_deploy/conf.d/gnocchi.yml.aio', 'ext/openstack_deploy/user_gnocchi_secrets.yml', 'tests/test-install-gnocchi.yml', 'ext/haproxy/service.yml.fragment', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tests/test-vars.yml', 'ext/openstack_deploy/env.d/gnocchi.yml', 'run_tests.sh', 'ext/repo_packages/openstack_gnocchi.yml', 'ext/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'tasks/gnocchi_db_setup.yml', 'ext/playbooks/os-gnocchi-install.yml', 'templates/gnocchi.conf.j2'], 'message': "Normalize galera password and clean up role

The role has historically used a different password variable.
Because the role is being maintained by the community now it makes
more sense to normalize the password for ease of maintenance.

The no-longer needed operations to create the DB and grant access
are removed from the role as these are in the integrated project's
playbook now. These tasks are added as pre_tasks for testing.

Similarly, the contents of the /ext directory are eliminated as
these are no longer needed since all of the contents have been
applied to the integrated gate.

Finally a run_tests.sh file is added for consistency and to fix the
bashate lint job which fails when there are not matching shell
scripts.

Change-Id: I7b9046dfe7ba258218b4d14ec8d4f270e917ca34
"}]
commit_message:
Normalize galera password and clean up role

The role has historically used a different password variable.
Because the role is being maintained by the community now it makes
more sense to normalize the password for ease of maintenance.

The no-longer needed operations to create the DB and grant access
are removed from the role as these are in the integrated project's
playbook now. These tasks are added as pre_tasks for testing.

Similarly, the contents of the /ext directory are eliminated as
these are no longer needed since all of the contents have been
applied to the integrated gate.

Finally a run_tests.sh file is added for consistency and to fix the
bashate lint job which fails when there are not matching shell
scripts.

Change-Id: I7b9046dfe7ba258218b4d14ec8d4f270e917ca34

resource can already be in catalog with another tag. Keep standard
'openstack' tag.

subject: Enable additional gate checks
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-26 07:58:46.000000000', 'files': ['murano-ci/jenkins/jobs/murano_jobs.yaml', 'murano-ci/zuul/layout.yaml', 'murano-ci/zuul/openstack_functions.py'], 'message': 'Enable additional gate checks

 Changes to murano-deployment repo should be
checked by all murano gates since they all are
dependent from scripts placed in murano-deployment
repository.
 This commit achieves this by adding
set_params function which does next:
 - launches gate-murano-* jobs on master branch
 - sets MURANO_DEPLOYMENT_REF parameter to
   ref of needed murano-deployment change for gate-murano-*
   jobs

Change-Id: I11a877569d793dc4d6f80fa09645facc605ec3d0
'}]
commit_message:
Enable additional gate checks

 Changes to murano-deployment repo should be
checked by all murano gates since they all are
dependent from scripts placed in murano-deployment
repository.
 This commit achieves this by adding
set_params function which does next:
 - launches gate-murano-* jobs on master branch
 - sets MURANO_DEPLOYMENT_REF parameter to
   ref of needed murano-deployment change for gate-murano-*
   jobs

Change-Id: I11a877569d793dc4d6f80fa09645facc605ec3d0

Logic of share-network creation was dependent on presense of "JOB_NAME"
env var. And it is unavailable now. Moreover, we do not really need to
depend on it. Therefore, remove dependency on it and assume we always
run CI without nova-network enabled.

Change-Id: Ic03e2166101a4deb13e8a8545d2fb2506454a20a
Closes-Bug: #1595160
(cherry picked from commit 6e156835399a58bf5cabe15942a7fdc9e1104bc9)

'}]
commit_message:
[CI] Fix devstack hooks to unblock CI

Logic of share-network creation was dependent on presense of "JOB_NAME"
env var. And it is unavailable now. Moreover, we do not really need to
depend on it. Therefore, remove dependency on it and assume we always
run CI without nova-network enabled.

Change-Id: Ic03e2166101a4deb13e8a8545d2fb2506454a20a
Closes-Bug: #1595160
(cherry picked from commit 6e156835399a58bf5cabe15942a7fdc9e1104bc9)
(cherry picked from commit a919058515d7210cd448b0646c4592d6efeb7e73)

commit_message:
Fix OVSBridge.set_protocols arg

For native ovsdb_interface compatibility, use a list instead of
a comma separated string for set_protocols argument.  The native
interface failed silently.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 14:33:31.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': 'nova: n-sproxy config consistency

This change makes the configuration of the serial_console section in the
nova.conf file consistent to that like the other console sections (VNC/SPICE).
That means, if the n-sproxy service is not enabled, disable the feature in
the nova.conf file. This should avoid confusion for people who expect the
feature to work after enabling the necessary service.

Change-Id: I5977b9a275e1451fa3baf37ae6e1130371249fef
'}]
commit_message:
nova: n-sproxy config consistency

This change makes the configuration of the serial_console section in the
nova.conf file consistent to that like the other console sections (VNC/SPICE).
That means, if the n-sproxy service is not enabled, disable the feature in
the nova.conf file. This should avoid confusion for people who expect the
feature to work after enabling the necessary service.

Change-Id: I5977b9a275e1451fa3baf37ae6e1130371249fef

commit_message:
profile/base/nova: declare nova class and configure cache correctly.

Nova {} workaround is not working correctly, we need to merge this patch
so we can move out ::nova from THT completely.

Also we need to use nova::cache to configure memcached parameters.

Co-Authorized-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Co-Authorized-By: Sven Anderson <sven@redhat.com>
Co-Authorized-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow tox to be run with python 3

The tox.ini has some unicode characters that cannot be
decoded, so just executing tox will immediately cause an error
because the tox.ini cannot be parsed.

Closes-Bug: #1600068
Change-Id: Ia01ae80d9321584845bb06c3f6673d13027bd2db
(cherry picked from commit b06c7e857edbffe21745e0c85b021cc2d7423a7f)

commit_message:
Macvtap: Allow noop alias as FW driver

The macvtap agent only works with the NoopFWDriver. If another
driver is configured it terminates. Today only the explicit
configuration "neutron.agent.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver" is
accepted. This patch enables the macvtap agent to also accept
the alias "noop"

Change-Id: I0d6f0b780a3881419243f12487e8b3d10e709f6c
Closes-Bug: #1587498
(cherry picked from commit 96d1d914ca0976fb6e8c7962d4d97f8553c4847e)

commit_message:
Lower ML2 message severity.

Logging that a network has no segments as an error
message when it doesn't impact execution pollutes
logs.  Lower the message severity to debug.

Change-Id: I7d88581b4703e7c287cec9406dd093089db8595c
Closes-Bug: #1597362
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 00f3ab1f132de6b701c7832626457ad51dd265b6)

commit_message:
Add CLI tests to check JSON response body

Test JSON response output to console for commands:
node-list,
node-show,
node-validate,
node-show-states,
node-create,
node-update.

commit_message:
[Verify] Adding '--skip-list' arg to `rally verify start` cmd

Sometimes we need to run the full test suite without some tests.
Now the new '--skip-list' argument allows us to do it. In order to skip
the desired tests we just need to list the tests in some file and provide
the '--skip-list' argument with the path to the file:

    rally verify start --skip-list /path/to/the/file

Also, missing messages about incompatibility of arguments were added.

Change-Id: I882bfacd2e39bed2b54af4092752f642c964975a

Logging that a network has no segments as an error
message when it doesn't impact execution pollutes
logs.  Lower the message severity to debug.

Change-Id: I7d88581b4703e7c287cec9406dd093089db8595c
Closes-Bug: #1597362

commit_message:
Lower ML2 message severity.

Logging that a network has no segments as an error
message when it doesn't impact execution pollutes
logs.  Lower the message severity to debug.

Change-Id: I7d88581b4703e7c287cec9406dd093089db8595c
Closes-Bug: #1597362
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 00f3ab1f132de6b701c7832626457ad51dd265b6)

commit_message:
Update initialize_connection to use versionedobjects

The following patch updates initialize_connection
API to use volume versionedobjects.  Changes were
made to be backwards compatible with older RPC clients.
It only includes changes to the core cinder code.
Changes in the drivers are left to each driver
maintainer to update.

Note that this patch DOES NOT try to use object dot
notation everywhere, since it would increase the
size of the patch.  Instead, it will be done in
subsequent patches.

Co-Authored-By: Thang Pham <thang.g.pham@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ib45cf5934b09fb2de9c228160bbad39c8a896e26
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

commit_message:
Remove usage of private '_url' property from OSC

Due to a recent change in OSC (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329189/)
some attributes that were previously private but available were removed.
This patch just assumes that the url is not available and gets the
endpoint regardless. It removes the necessecity for accessing the
private property.

Change-Id: I680f1a76aab1a94883bc58de241fd0d65d1cb78a
Closes-Bug: #1605876

subject: Tighten the trusty job filter for OpenStack-Ansible properly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 17:01:25.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Tighten the trusty job filter for OpenStack-Ansible properly

Only the functional jobs should run, not the docs jobs too. As the
functional jobs could be 'func' or any other name, a negative match
is used on the docs job name instead.

The previous attempt at this didn't work properly.

The following should not pass the regex test:
- gate-openstack-ansible-docs-ubuntu-trusty-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-docs-ubuntu-trusty
- gate-openstack-ansible-repo_build-ansible-docs-ubuntu-trusty-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-repo_build-ansible-docs-ubuntu-trusty

The following should pass the regex test:
- gate-openstack-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty
- gate-openstack-ansible-repo_build-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-repo_build-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty

Change-Id: I595c926d1e441777303c6f5ecb68ba72abbae0c6
"}]
commit_message:
Tighten the trusty job filter for OpenStack-Ansible properly

Only the functional jobs should run, not the docs jobs too. As the
functional jobs could be 'func' or any other name, a negative match
is used on the docs job name instead.

The previous attempt at this didn't work properly.

The following should not pass the regex test:
- gate-openstack-ansible-docs-ubuntu-trusty-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-docs-ubuntu-trusty
- gate-openstack-ansible-repo_build-ansible-docs-ubuntu-trusty-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-repo_build-ansible-docs-ubuntu-trusty

The following should pass the regex test:
- gate-openstack-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty
- gate-openstack-ansible-repo_build-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-repo_build-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty

Change-Id: I595c926d1e441777303c6f5ecb68ba72abbae0c6

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-18 07:39:29.000000000', 'files': ['freezer/openstack/backup.py', 'freezer/common/config.py', 'freezer/job.py'], 'message': 'Change cinder backup to define full backup or incremental backup

Now, freezer backup cinder through cindernative, if volume have a
backup, it must be incremental, it is unfriendly.
Increase  incremental parameter to backup cinder volume. Default
freezer backup volume do a full backup, if cremental, it shoud do
a incremental backup.

eg:

Do a full backup:
freezer-agent --cindernative-vol-id eb7e8d07-800f-4de8-a918-38aa36e2ef83

Do a incremental backup:

freezer-agent --cindernative-vol-id eb7e8d07-800f-4de8-a918-38aa36e2ef83 --incremental

Closes-Bug: #1592322

Change-Id: I31c8c2875e275511448d4dcb53425d011e91bb5d
'}]
commit_message:
Change cinder backup to define full backup or incremental backup

Now, freezer backup cinder through cindernative, if volume have a
backup, it must be incremental, it is unfriendly.
Increase  incremental parameter to backup cinder volume. Default
freezer backup volume do a full backup, if cremental, it shoud do
a incremental backup.

eg:

Do a full backup:
freezer-agent --cindernative-vol-id eb7e8d07-800f-4de8-a918-38aa36e2ef83

Do a incremental backup:

freezer-agent --cindernative-vol-id eb7e8d07-800f-4de8-a918-38aa36e2ef83 --incremental

Closes-Bug: #1592322

Change-Id: I31c8c2875e275511448d4dcb53425d011e91bb5d

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-25 14:43:42.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/tests/unit/test_http.py', 'glanceclient/tests/unit/v1/test_shell.py', 'glanceclient/common/http.py', 'glanceclient/common/utils.py', 'glanceclient/exc.py', 'glanceclient/tests/unit/test_exc.py'], 'message': 'py3: Fix encoding and use sys.stdin.buffer

* exc.py: Encode body in response before calling replace over it.
* http.py: prepend the bytes literal to the empty string or else
  we hit bug 1342080 again in python 3.
* utils.py: Use sys.stdin.buffer in python 3.

Change-Id: Ieefb8c633658e507486438e5518c5d53e819027d
'}]
commit_message:
py3: Fix encoding and use sys.stdin.buffer

* exc.py: Encode body in response before calling replace over it.
* http.py: prepend the bytes literal to the empty string or else
  we hit bug 1342080 again in python 3.
* utils.py: Use sys.stdin.buffer in python 3.

Change-Id: Ieefb8c633658e507486438e5518c5d53e819027d

commit_message:
Put neutron provider commands in neutron.rb

This allows to gain access to all neutron commands using composability,
see[1] for an example.  It removes some redundancy as well.  Finally, it
looks more like the openstacklib/**/openstack.rb provider code.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347468/

Change-Id: Iad0354f5babd86822e37053f3f7a1134803fd4f8

commit_message:
TCP-based messenging support

This adds several simple classes which may be used to exchange messages
over an established tcp connection and watch if this connection is
interrupted.

This will used by MuranoPL debugger

Change-Id: Ie9936f5e16ca76127d8d211ad0f2ef347b69f738
Targets-blueprint: muranopl-debugger

Set secure_proxy_ssl_header 'HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO' for nova-api

Since this option isn't in puppet-nova we can set the value using
nova_config.

Closes-Bug: 1606863

commit_message:
Make create_object_with_dependency cleanup

This adjusts the create_object_with_dependency helper function
to attempt to cleanup any dependency it was responsible for creating
if it encounters a failure in trying to attach a child to the
dependency.

Change-Id: I363f3a299c55e5063b4239028728bb5593132010
Related-Bug: #1548285

subject: Extend specs matcher to support ">" and "<"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 16:11:18.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/specs_matcher.py', 'oslo_utils/tests/test_specs_matcher.py'], 'message': 'Extend specs matcher to support ">" and "<"

This patch is exteding the specs matcher and adding support for the ">"
and "<" operators. Prior to this patch, only the "equal" forms were
supported (">=" and "<=").

It also looks inconsistent because for the "s" prefixed operators all
the 4 forms are supported already: "s<=", "s<", "s>=" and "s>".

Change-Id: I82a72b0ef6ee277e7b09b0eb138e058687ce8804
'}]
commit_message:
Extend specs matcher to support ">" and "<"

This patch is exteding the specs matcher and adding support for the ">"
and "<" operators. Prior to this patch, only the "equal" forms were
supported (">=" and "<=").

It also looks inconsistent because for the "s" prefixed operators all
the 4 forms are supported already: "s<=", "s<", "s>=" and "s>".

Change-Id: I82a72b0ef6ee277e7b09b0eb138e058687ce8804

commit_message:
Update Versioned Objects with Cluster object

This patch adds Cluster Versioned Object as counterpart for the Cluster
ORM class, and updates ConsistencyGroup, Volume, and Service Versioned
Objects.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/327283
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Ie6857cf7db52cf284d89bad704e2c679e5549966

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 15:37:00.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/sphinxext.py'], 'message': "disable lazy translation in sphinx extension

The sphinx extension depends on all of the help text associated with an
option being regular strings. When oslo_i18n's lazy translation feature
is turned on, the marker functions return Message objects that do not
support all of the features of strings. Add a step to turn off lazy
evaluation when the oslo_context.sphinxext extension is activated.

Change-Id: Icaec4691135cd07d96994f01498e0f9d2e09af58
Closes-Bug: #1605648
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
disable lazy translation in sphinx extension

The sphinx extension depends on all of the help text associated with an
option being regular strings. When oslo_i18n's lazy translation feature
is turned on, the marker functions return Message objects that do not
support all of the features of strings. Add a step to turn off lazy
evaluation when the oslo_context.sphinxext extension is activated.

Change-Id: Icaec4691135cd07d96994f01498e0f9d2e09af58
Closes-Bug: #1605648
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Implements adding a subresource (of extensions) to its parents
A resource and a subresource has a parent-child relationship, for
example:
A qos resource has a subresource of bandwith_limit_rules. This patch
will allow urls like : /qos/policies/{policy_id}/bandwidth_limit_rules to

Change-Id: Ib2288234710fd6eed7fb9f6b880f57c9dd3beade
'}]
commit_message:
Add subresources support for PECAN

Implements adding a subresource (of extensions) to its parents
A resource and a subresource has a parent-child relationship, for
example:
A qos resource has a subresource of bandwith_limit_rules. This patch
will allow urls like : /qos/policies/{policy_id}/bandwidth_limit_rules to
work.

Change-Id: Ib2288234710fd6eed7fb9f6b880f57c9dd3beade

commit_message:
Migrate Puppet Hieradata to composable services

Migrate puppet/hieradata/*.yaml parameters to puppet/services/*.yaml
except for some services that are not composable yet.

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7e5f8b18ee9aa63a1dffc6facaf88315b07d5fd7

commit_message:
Release glance-store 0.15.0

The 0.14.0 failed the glance gate for docs and was blocking the review
queue. So, we need this quick follow up release to fix the glance gate
and use all the commits and fixes proposed therein from the prior one.

More explanation about the same is given in bug 1606746 and bug 1605648

Change-Id: I4d17375d2a716581633a5eb91bd6c44ff0a64ab8

commit_message:
release oslo.rootwrap 5.0.0

This releases oslo.rootwrap 5.0.0 which has a hard coded allow for
privsep-helper to assist in the upgrade and transition to privsep in
projects and libraries. It is a major release because of this
addition.

Change-Id: I791fc2d450fafbc56a12804d8daf88a08a9ef214

commit_message:
Fix handler case where no old process is found

In cases where no old process was found, the shell
command was exiting 1 and causing the handler to report
a failure.

Change-Id: Ic1701f7495abdec713c05d2c95bfdd1e7b1ff73d
Closes-Bug: #1603136
(cherry picked from commit 30899b83683242e2346cbab4413409d1ea49ea5e)

if network template has been applied to new cluster.

With the introduction of IpmiNode it's better to use node.start()
method, because node.create() works only for virtual slaves

commit_message:
Replace node.create() with node.start() in warm_start_nodes

With the introduction of IpmiNode it's better to use node.start()
method, because node.create() works only for virtual slaves

Also:
+ add configurable timeout to the warm and cold restart methods

Change-Id: I4968d62c2b431271928b55672431422cb5527f7a
Closes-Bug: #1603351

subject: Fix cinder config string as per current i18n state
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-27 02:13:59.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/cinder.py'], 'message': 'Fix cinder config string as per current i18n state

As described in the bug 1605648 , the translations being done on the
config string are not permitting additions so, the glance docs
generation is failing.

The glance_store 0.14.0 had to be pinned down to let glance review queue
not break. see updates on this thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2016-July/thread.html#8899

The config strings need to be non additive for translations and will
enable future releases of glance_store. Once, a appropriate fix is
published for bug 1605648 the config strings can be more flexible.

Change-Id: Ia6ed5883458f2e81e861cda02068956728e76357
Closes-Bug: 1606746
Partial-Bug: 1605648
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder config string as per current i18n state

As described in the bug 1605648 , the translations being done on the
config string are not permitting additions so, the glance docs
generation is failing.

The glance_store 0.14.0 had to be pinned down to let glance review queue
not break. see updates on this thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2016-July/thread.html#8899

The config strings need to be non additive for translations and will
enable future releases of glance_store. Once, a appropriate fix is
published for bug 1605648 the config strings can be more flexible.

Change-Id: Ia6ed5883458f2e81e861cda02068956728e76357
Closes-Bug: 1606746
Partial-Bug: 1605648

subject: Run Gnocchi MySQL jobs on Ubuntu Xenial
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-26 14:20:06.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Run Gnocchi MySQL jobs on Ubuntu Xenial

Gnocchi needs new features available in MySQL >= 5.6, and Trusty only
has MySQL 5.5. Switch to MySQL 5.7 by using Ubuntu Xenial.

Remove MySQL + Python 3.4 also, as we have 3.5 covered already.

Change-Id: Ia1fd815c73d568922594f68d8e9ed2a9ebc55bb0
'}]
commit_message:
Run Gnocchi MySQL jobs on Ubuntu Xenial

Gnocchi needs new features available in MySQL >= 5.6, and Trusty only
has MySQL 5.5. Switch to MySQL 5.7 by using Ubuntu Xenial.

Remove MySQL + Python 3.4 also, as we have 3.5 covered already.

Change-Id: Ia1fd815c73d568922594f68d8e9ed2a9ebc55bb0

subject: Don't assert exact to_dict output
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 08:45:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_context.py'], 'message': "Don't assert exact to_dict output

The context.to_dict in turn calls the oslo.context to_dict. By enforcing
the exact dictionary output of the to_dict tests will fail any time that
oslo.context changes the output of to_dict. This happened with the
release of oslo.context 2.6.0.

For nova testing purposes we should only assert properties of the
dictionary output that were added by nova and rely on oslo.context doing
the correct thing regarding deserializing its own options.

Related-Bug: #1602081
Change-Id: Ib91a73a017e02b48ec01bbf8c28f946fb5120ba5
(cherry picked from commit 9f99f6c212c38f8ae26c6aeee4b4521cbf9207a4)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't assert exact to_dict output

The context.to_dict in turn calls the oslo.context to_dict. By enforcing
the exact dictionary output of the to_dict tests will fail any time that
oslo.context changes the output of to_dict. This happened with the
release of oslo.context 2.6.0.

For nova testing purposes we should only assert properties of the
dictionary output that were added by nova and rely on oslo.context doing
the correct thing regarding deserializing its own options.

Related-Bug: #1602081
Change-Id: Ib91a73a017e02b48ec01bbf8c28f946fb5120ba5
(cherry picked from commit 9f99f6c212c38f8ae26c6aeee4b4521cbf9207a4)

subject: numa: avoid aborting when setting hw:numa_nodes is not integer number
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 08:15:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hardware.py'], 'message': 'numa: avoid aborting when setting hw:numa_nodes is not integer number

if we setting hw:numa_nodes not a integer number, int() translate method
will throw a ValueError, we should catch this error avoid aborting, and
set to 0 if it is not a valid value.

Change-Id: I0050ca23502bfb3a2cdbe6f0280d8a34fc0d821f
'}]
commit_message:
numa: avoid aborting when setting hw:numa_nodes is not integer number

if we setting hw:numa_nodes not a integer number, int() translate method
will throw a ValueError, we should catch this error avoid aborting, and
set to 0 if it is not a valid value.

Change-Id: I0050ca23502bfb3a2cdbe6f0280d8a34fc0d821f

subject: Render configs always needs the cluster relation
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-27 15:21:29.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'src/lib/charm/openstack/designate.py', 'unit_tests/test_designate_handlers.py', 'src/reactive/designate_handlers.py'], 'message': "Render configs always needs the cluster relation

Render configs always needs the cluster relation if it is available.
There is logic in OpenStackAPIRelationAdapters that checks to see if
this unit is alone. If it is it creates a 'cluster' namespace and
populates it with data specific to this node.  If this unit has peers
then OpenStackAPIRelationAdapters populates the cluster namespace with
PeerHARelationAdapter *if* a cluster relation has been passed in. If
the unit has peers but the Peer relation has *not* been passed in
there is no cluster namespace and rendering of config that relies on
it (namely haproxy) fails.

To fix this, check if the relation exists and if it does add it to
the list of relations used to render configs

Change-Id: I6f34c28411db957d0b55155b8671bf981084bb6b
"}]
commit_message:
Render configs always needs the cluster relation

Render configs always needs the cluster relation if it is available.
There is logic in OpenStackAPIRelationAdapters that checks to see if
this unit is alone. If it is it creates a 'cluster' namespace and
populates it with data specific to this node.  If this unit has peers
then OpenStackAPIRelationAdapters populates the cluster namespace with
PeerHARelationAdapter *if* a cluster relation has been passed in. If
the unit has peers but the Peer relation has *not* been passed in
there is no cluster namespace and rendering of config that relies on
it (namely haproxy) fails.

To fix this, check if the relation exists and if it does add it to
the list of relations used to render configs

Change-Id: I6f34c28411db957d0b55155b8671bf981084bb6b

subject: Add pkg dep for python-apt
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-27 15:18:23.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'src/lib/charm/openstack/aodh.py'], 'message': "Add pkg dep for python-apt

The hacluster charm depends on python-apt but doesn't explicitly
install it. For other charms this has been working by accident as
they have had a dependancy on python-apt themselves in some way.
Fixing it in the hacluster charm is the correct approach but is
non-trivial so temporarily fix add it as a dep to this charm so it
is installed by the principle before hacluster is installed.

Related-Bug: #1606906

Change-Id: I07e575f7096aa528d85ac5f7f23318ceb44b66ac
"}]
commit_message:
Add pkg dep for python-apt

The hacluster charm depends on python-apt but doesn't explicitly
install it. For other charms this has been working by accident as
they have had a dependancy on python-apt themselves in some way.
Fixing it in the hacluster charm is the correct approach but is
non-trivial so temporarily fix add it as a dep to this charm so it
is installed by the principle before hacluster is installed.

Related-Bug: #1606906

Change-Id: I07e575f7096aa528d85ac5f7f23318ceb44b66ac

commit_message:
Allow all master dns nodes to send notifys

When deployed with mutliple masters the slave will reject notifys
from them so explicitly list all masters who can send notifys.

Minor fir to amulet test as designate no longer creates a default
nameserver

Change-Id: I60397375d3bda317b2b6acfcfc37686d73d1a855

subject: Add crypt algorithm to digest
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-27 19:00:05.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot/functions.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'message': "Add crypt algorithm to digest

Unix password hashes are generated using crypt(3). This commit adds
crypt to the digest intrinsic function and adds an option map as an
optional 3rd argument. Initially, the only option is 'salt', which is
required to use crypt and also simplifies creating salted hashes using
the other algorithms.

Change-Id: If3e3d63029c3f9f05ddace065f4243d3551b5015
Implements: blueprint digest-add-crypt
"}]
commit_message:
Add crypt algorithm to digest

Unix password hashes are generated using crypt(3). This commit adds
crypt to the digest intrinsic function and adds an option map as an
optional 3rd argument. Initially, the only option is 'salt', which is
required to use crypt and also simplifies creating salted hashes using
the other algorithms.

Change-Id: If3e3d63029c3f9f05ddace065f4243d3551b5015
Implements: blueprint digest-add-crypt

  networking-l2gw project

Change-Id: Ia6d40a8f66adc649c5d85828fb371f07f2e72199

commit_message:
Disable l2gw cli extension

Disable our variant of l2gw cli extension for now because:

- It needs networking-l2gw installed, but we don't want to make it
  a hard requirement right now

- It uses the duplicated entry ("l2_gateway") as the one provided by
  networking-l2gw project

Closes-Bug: #1599043
Related-Bug: #1580566
Change-Id: Ia6d40a8f66adc649c5d85828fb371f07f2e72199

commit_message:
Revert "Don't assert exact to_dict output"

We discussed this at the mid-cycle and this wasn't the direction we
agreed to.

Known the exact format enables nova to understand issues with cross
release upgrade.

This reverts commit 9f99f6c212c38f8ae26c6aeee4b4521cbf9207a4.

Change-Id: I9ff2e7de5ba7691e302a29e6120d8a1d21db8cfb
