commit_message:
Switch all xstatic projects to the correct publish job

publish-to-pypi isn't the correct publish template for xstatic packeages
instead it shoudl be xstatic-publish-jobs, as this understand the
versioning scheme in use.

Update all xstatic packages to the corerct publish template.

Change-Id: I759019f38b6a535e978d75cb95f1fc0db9597390

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-27 18:08:30.000000000', 'files': ['networking_l2gw/tests/unit/services/l2gateway/agent/ovsdb/test_manager.py', 'networking_l2gw/tests/unit/services/l2gateway/agent/ovsdb/test_ovsdb_writer.py', 'networking_l2gw/tests/unit/services/l2gateway/test_agent_scheduler.py', 'networking_l2gw/tests/unit/services/l2gateway/service_drivers/test_rpc_l2gw.py', 'networking_l2gw/tests/unit/services/l2gateway/agent/test_l2gw_agent.py', 'networking_l2gw/tests/unit/services/l2gateway/common/test_tunnel_calls.py', 'networking_l2gw/tests/unit/services/l2gateway/agent/ovsdb/test_ovsdb_monitor.py', 'networking_l2gw/tests/unit/services/l2gateway/ovsdb/test_data.py', 'tox.ini', 'networking_l2gw/tests/unit/services/l2gateway/agent/ovsdb/test_base_connection.py', 'networking_l2gw/tests/unit/services/l2gateway/test_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Python 3: add support

The patche does the following:
1. remove nested with calls from unit tests
2. updates tox.ini to enable us to use the \ at the end
   of a line
3. All integers in python 3 are long.
4. Python 3 does not support __builtin__. Removed it from the tests.

Now the unit tests pass when running python 3.

This also adds support to tox.

Change-Id: Iacbf0c2c05248819af817109e7dd637f71c82404
'}]
commit_message:
Python 3: add support

The patche does the following:
1. remove nested with calls from unit tests
2. updates tox.ini to enable us to use the \ at the end
   of a line
3. All integers in python 3 are long.
4. Python 3 does not support __builtin__. Removed it from the tests.

Now the unit tests pass when running python 3.

This also adds support to tox.

Change-Id: Iacbf0c2c05248819af817109e7dd637f71c82404

subject: Add check for member id
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-05-12 07:57:44.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/v2/test_image_members_resource.py', 'glance/api/v2/image_members.py'], 'message': "Add check for member id

If the member id contain the character '#', it can't be delete
anymore. Because the request url can't analysis this kind of id.

And the member id means project(tenant) id which contains only
numbers and letters.

So we should keep the same with keystone's project id and should
contain only numbers and letters in the member id.

lite spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/315388/

APIimpact

Change-Id: I9294d3c4431fff5946d6ae9f969130cb4e43e750
"}]
commit_message:
Add check for member id

If the member id contain the character '#', it can't be delete
anymore. Because the request url can't analysis this kind of id.

And the member id means project(tenant) id which contains only
numbers and letters.

So we should keep the same with keystone's project id and should
contain only numbers and letters in the member id.

lite spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/315388/

APIimpact

Change-Id: I9294d3c4431fff5946d6ae9f969130cb4e43e750

commit_message:
Add cluster job distribution

This patch adds a new mechanism to distribute jobs to c-vol nodes with
the addition of the "cluster" configuration option.

DocImpact: New cluster configuration option
Specs: https://review.openstack.org/327283
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Id0a2e4c6a7b5f17e4ee3484ae1b53c03d472b586

commit_message:
improved scaling for cdh plugin

this fixes issues with decommissioning nodes,
when gateway nodes are included. additionally,
restarting of stale services are required to
for redeployment of configs.

Change-Id: I9d439936c0e2f851054735f0defba8efc592c84d
Closes-bug: 1597701

subject: Define default region name.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-25 18:18:53.000000000', 'files': ['templates/heat.conf.j2', 'tests/test.yml'], 'message': 'Define default region name.

If multiple regions exist, keystone_authtoken should contain region_name.
This prevents the service from authenticating across regions.

Also set default for all services to the region heat is installed in.

Change-Id: I14b2d145b52c1d396ac22c724a5b9ecb8fa7929e
'}]
commit_message:
Define default region name.

If multiple regions exist, keystone_authtoken should contain region_name.
This prevents the service from authenticating across regions.

Also set default for all services to the region heat is installed in.

Change-Id: I14b2d145b52c1d396ac22c724a5b9ecb8fa7929e

commit_message:
Use osc_lib instead of cliff

Base classes of commands are defined in cliff,
but have been encapsulated again in osc-lib
for all plugin clients. So use osc-lib instead of cliff.

Change-Id: I090da28b6d2bbea7eaa1a6503910ab38dfebf422

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-27 10:40:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_agentschedulers_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_segment.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/pecan_wsgi/test_functional.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/test_server.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_backend_mixin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_availability_zone.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_security_group.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/db/test_migrations.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_quotasv2.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/resources/config.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_port_binding.py'], 'message': 'tests: stop using ml2 plugin full import paths in tests

Stevedore documentation suggest that full import paths are not supposed
to be user visible. Since unit tests emulate users when configuring
oslo.config, we better off relying on well known plugin aliases than
internal details.

For in-tree that may be not a big deal, but with it we set a bad example
for third parties that may later find their tests broken eg. when we
decide to move code around.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7bd036ac3df7e7f4c678356d0a793e7d38599dda
'}]
commit_message:
tests: stop using ml2 plugin full import paths in tests

Stevedore documentation suggest that full import paths are not supposed
to be user visible. Since unit tests emulate users when configuring
oslo.config, we better off relying on well known plugin aliases than
internal details.

For in-tree that may be not a big deal, but with it we set a bad example
for third parties that may later find their tests broken eg. when we
decide to move code around.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7bd036ac3df7e7f4c678356d0a793e7d38599dda

commit_message:
Fix dict.keys() PY3 compatible

The dict.keys()[0] will raise a TypeError in PY3
as dict.keys() doesn't return a list any more in PY3
but a view of list.

Change-Id: Ib58f7130352aa4c2a4bae3a830a5a83ee8a711d1
Closes-Bug: #1583419

commit_message:
Base OpenStackClient(OSC) plugin support for Tacker

This patch enable tackerclient OSC plugin support. This
patch set does the following:
 1. Adds OSC to test-requirement.txt, setup.cfg
 2. Creates the OSC plugin
 3. Builds OSC plugin structure for tacker commands and
unit tests. Such as: VNF, VNFD, VIM, EXT.

The OSC plugin system is a command set for following OpenStack
services: Compute, Identity, Image, Object Storage, Block Storage
and Network. Other OpenStack services, such as Orchestration or
Telemetry may create an OpenStackClient plugin.So Tacker can do the
same.
Here is OSC plugin links:
  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-openstackclient/plugins.html

Here is the blueprint(Tacker OpenStackClient plugin )links:
  https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/tacker-openstackclient-plugin

Change-Id: I0f0db1b25dbff501058e81e59cbde5d49f62c46d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-18 16:31:37.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/image-generation-cli.rst'], 'message': 'Updates to image CLI from implementation

- Addition of root-filesystem arg to handle the rare
  case in which libguestfs cannot detect the correct
  root filesystem of the image.
- Variable name changes (longform only).
- Removal of multiple argument name options for image
  arguments (why add complexity or obscurity?)
- Minor change to pack_image signature.
- Fixed "variable" vs. "argument" naming convnetion
  in the ArgumentCaseValidator.

Change-Id: Idece2ed546d9e3365b3d4850d7d29f112da10be8
Describes: blueprint image-generation-cli
'}]
commit_message:
Updates to image CLI from implementation

Minor changes to feature implementation, including:
- PLUGIN and PLUGIN_VERSION proved much more elegant to
  implement as subcommands than as normal arguments.
- Addition of root-filesystem arg to handle the rare
  case in which libguestfs cannot detect the correct
  root filesystem of the image.
- Variable name changes (longform only).
- Removal of multiple argument name options for image
  arguments (why add complexity or obscurity?)
- Minor change to pack_image signature.
- Fixed "variable" vs. "argument" naming convnetion
  in the ArgumentCaseValidator.

Change-Id: Idece2ed546d9e3365b3d4850d7d29f112da10be8
Describes: blueprint image-generation-cli

commit_message:
enabling L2GW to work with DVR

In DVR mode no host IP is associated with the L3 Agent because
the router is configured on all the Compute Nodes and on the Network Node.
To overcome this problem we look for L3 Agent that is running on the Network Node,
resolve the hostname of the Network Node to get its IP address and use it to
configure the destination IP needed for neutron port location information.

Closes-Bug: 1463784

Change-Id: I2595c714ede896baa7726ceec793de9a7a29e6b2

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-27 08:53:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/network/rpcapi.py', 'nova/network/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'Call release_dhcp via RPC to ensure correct host

When deleting an instance in a nova-network environment, the network
manager calls release_dhcp() on the local host. The linux_net driver
then executes dhcp_release, a binary that comes with dnsmasq that
releases a DHCP lease on the local host. Upon lease release, dnsmasq
calls its dhcp-script, nova-dhcpbridge. The latter calls
release_fixed_ip() and the instance's fixed IP is returned to the
pool. This is fine if an instance has never been live-migrated.

If an instance has been live-migrated, the dnsmasq on its new
host fails with 'unknown lease' because it's not the same dnsmasq that
originally handed out the lease. Having failed, dnsmasq doesn't call
nova-dhcpbridge and release_fixed_ip() is never called. The fixed IP
is not returned to the pool and a new instance cannot be booted with
that IP.

This patches adds a release_dhcp RPC call that calls release_dhcp on
the instance's "original" host, thus ensuring that the correct dnsmasq
handles the lease release and that nova-dhcpbridge and
release_fixed_ip() are called.

Change-Id: I0eec8c995dd8cff50c37af83018697fc686fe727
Closes-bug: 1585601
'}]
commit_message:
Call release_dhcp via RPC to ensure correct host

When deleting an instance in a nova-network environment, the network
manager calls release_dhcp() on the local host. The linux_net driver
then executes dhcp_release, a binary that comes with dnsmasq that
releases a DHCP lease on the local host. Upon lease release, dnsmasq
calls its dhcp-script, nova-dhcpbridge. The latter calls
release_fixed_ip() and the instance's fixed IP is returned to the
pool. This is fine if an instance has never been live-migrated.

If an instance has been live-migrated, the dnsmasq on its new
host fails with 'unknown lease' because it's not the same dnsmasq that
originally handed out the lease. Having failed, dnsmasq doesn't call
nova-dhcpbridge and release_fixed_ip() is never called. The fixed IP
is not returned to the pool and a new instance cannot be booted with
that IP.

This patches adds a release_dhcp RPC call that calls release_dhcp on
the instance's "original" host, thus ensuring that the correct dnsmasq
handles the lease release and that nova-dhcpbridge and
release_fixed_ip() are called.

Change-Id: I0eec8c995dd8cff50c37af83018697fc686fe727
Closes-bug: 1585601

commit_message:
Fix 'reconfigure' command of kolla

Changed the order of the 'when' statements in "remove/restart
containers" tasks. It will fix the reconfiguration problem when
deploying different components on different hosts.

Change-Id: Ibee9dd56b6128b664144deb1d9eb7ec32e39fd5c
Closes-Bug: #1603943

commit_message:
always use pip constraints

This flips the tox.ini to always use constraints installation for
all targets. It drops the extra -constraints targets in the process.
This makes it so there is no developer change required to operate in our
new world order.

Change-Id: I2b56835edb2d75b7c871aae030e909578dbb9
Depends-On: I0b582ac2c7c227faf72bf701dfa88e83a8ba9ee6

Use "arp -n" when finding gateway MAC for netconsole

"gateway" which fails the grep.  Avoid this.

commit_message:
Bring models in sync with migrations, add test

Bring the sqlalchemy models in sync with the alembic migrations.

Add the neutron standard model-migration sync test. The test is added
to the unit test env since l2gw does not have a functional job
yet. This requires that l2gw uses the python-db-jobs template in the
gate.

(Also remove downgrades since they are not supported.)

Closes-Bug: #1605675

Depends-On: I3a8ea02b86846e9a8a7d7f2aee9700ca952b0248

Change-Id: Ib73f554d5f0bbfbe25a0f6ad33b23e4584800e21

commit_message:
tox.ini: Change the way to exclude l2gw tests for py34/py35

The previous way was necessary to avoid import-time errors for
bgp plugin tests.  Now bgp plugin was fixed, [1] it's no longer
necessary.

The new way would allow concurrent test runs, which might
improve the situation for the Related-Bug.

[1] I1585a84f1fa2722b36a733a4a9551b7a0d3de210

Related-Bug: #1604649
Change-Id: Ib1cab9a5f2dcc6faa0210cd5a0cfcb77c48dfcfa

commit_message:
Developer Registry Resource Browser

Developer dashboard panel which shows:
- resource types currently in the resource registry browser
- the details that are set for each resource type
- links to generic table views (if available)
- available actions (with WIP mechanism to exercise the action)

To test:
- Open Developer -> Resources
- notice how Images item is green
- exercise some of the global actions (create image)
- enter an image id to exercise the item actions
- batch actions not currently testable
- click the images "Generic Table View" link

Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-registry
Change-Id: Ib931fac9917a50c268b2e63ff7a0de42052c62c8

* Task result should be not be included when a collection of
  task executions is requested because: 1) practically result
  of individual task may be long 2) in order to extract it we
  have to query action executions for every task execution,
  the result operation becomes extremely heavy even for small
  data sets. If task result is needed it should be requested
  individually. This behavior was broken during the recent
  refactoring in API layer.
* Other minor changes

Change-Id: I46697e24d826bd2b705ca61b188e9bed66888876
'}]
commit_message:
Remove task result for collection REST requests

* Task result should be not be included when a collection of
  task executions is requested because: 1) practically result
  of individual task may be long 2) in order to extract it we
  have to query action executions for every task execution,
  the result operation becomes extremely heavy even for small
  data sets. If task result is needed it should be requested
  individually. This behavior was broken during the recent
  refactoring in API layer.
* Other minor changes

Change-Id: I46697e24d826bd2b705ca61b188e9bed66888876

subject: Implement new attach/detach Cinder flow
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 23:25:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/volume/cinder.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'message': 'Implement new attach/detach Cinder flow

***************** WIP/POC ********************
Lots of details to address here, but this is a quick POC
to show a new workflow using Cinder create/remove attachment.

Goal of this patch was just to make this work for the standard
attach/detach path.  Still has a few places that need updated,
also we'll want to add some things on Cinder's side like a
refresh connection_info (rather than calling initialize_connection).

Currently we still use reserve etc, but we consolidate
initialize_connection and attach calls into a single
"create_attachment" call.

Same with terminate and destach, we combine those into a single
"remove_attachment" call.

Things that need to be done:
* Clearly there are quite a few places we still need to update (or we can leave
them calling the old mechanism).  The good thing about this approach is it's
not a BigBang change, we can keep using old methods at the same time.

* Take a look at the cleanup of connections (ie rm /dev/disk-by-path) and
  use either the return from list_attachments, or remove_attachment to
  determine if/when we should delete that connection (think multi-attach)

* API micro-versioning?

* Unit tests of course

Change-Id: I9c07a7282e57aa2decce1ca06b6a70b399432f8d
Depends-On: I90d54257862e1815a03ca8750040f7e4e6f35c0b
Depends-On: Ib4d229778b9f691ae86fca50059cca4c0958fcf8
'}]
commit_message:
Implement new attach/detach Cinder flow

***************** WIP/POC ********************
Lots of details to address here, but this is a quick POC
to show a new workflow using Cinder create/remove attachment.

Goal of this patch was just to make this work for the standard
attach/detach path.  Still has a few places that need updated,
also we'll want to add some things on Cinder's side like a
refresh connection_info (rather than calling initialize_connection).

Currently we still use reserve etc, but we consolidate
initialize_connection and attach calls into a single
"create_attachment" call.

Same with terminate and destach, we combine those into a single
"remove_attachment" call.

Things that need to be done:
* Clearly there are quite a few places we still need to update (or we can leave
them calling the old mechanism).  The good thing about this approach is it's
not a BigBang change, we can keep using old methods at the same time.

* Take a look at the cleanup of connections (ie rm /dev/disk-by-path) and
  use either the return from list_attachments, or remove_attachment to
  determine if/when we should delete that connection (think multi-attach)

* API micro-versioning?

* Unit tests of course

Change-Id: I9c07a7282e57aa2decce1ca06b6a70b399432f8d
Depends-On: I90d54257862e1815a03ca8750040f7e4e6f35c0b
Depends-On: Ib4d229778b9f691ae86fca50059cca4c0958fcf8

Implements: blueprint count-endpoint

commit_message:
Add totals to facets

Modifies the /facets response to include doc count totals:
  {"resource_type": {"doc_count": 2, "facets": [facets]}}

include_fields controls whether "facets" are included. The
default is True; if False, only the doc_count for each type
will be returned (and the query is consequently much simpler).

Change-Id: I273af71d65df6d656c38e634caa5eb9f45e69241
Implements: blueprint count-endpoint

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-12 15:36:59.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/deployment_guide.rst', 'doc/source/overview_ring.rst'], 'message': 'Add region in ring structure & deployment guide

Deployment guide does not talk about the region. Also, it does not
specify that regions and zones need to be ints.

This patch adds brief description about region and changes numbers
to int. Also, adds region in the document that talks about ring data

commit_message:
Add region in ring structure & deployment guide

Deployment guide does not talk about the region. Also, it does not
specify that regions and zones need to be ints.

This patch adds brief description about region and changes numbers
to int. Also, adds region in the document that talks about ring data
struture.

Change-Id: I04ce42fb3e5c1f08e7f7ff6be23482cee8bdeb71
Partial-Bug: #1583551

Based on the work in Cinder,
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/shared-backend-config
support for Cinder drivers in the DEFAULT section will be elimiated,
this fix starts a similar change for the puppet cinder module.

Change-Id: Iea1ebb5726ff4e3bf28e11f2f443b7198b4e36bc
Implements: blueprint remove-drivers-in-default
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate drivers in Cinder.conf DEFAULT section.

Based on the work in Cinder,
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/shared-backend-config
support for Cinder drivers in the DEFAULT section will be elimiated,
this fix starts a similar change for the puppet cinder module.

Change-Id: Iea1ebb5726ff4e3bf28e11f2f443b7198b4e36bc
Implements: blueprint remove-drivers-in-default

subject: Use UTC time when update lockedobject timestamp
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-27 00:41:44.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/db/neutron/lockedobjects_db.py', 'dragonflow/db/neutron/models.py'], 'message': 'Use UTC time when update lockedobject timestamp

1. Oslo uses UTC time to compare two timestamp, this patch
replace the local time in create_at field of lockedobject
with UTC time.

2. Remove unused method _update_lock

Change-Id: Id3de285a217b8651da27dc66246f81206230f4c7
Closes-Bug: #1598542
'}]
commit_message:
Use UTC time when update lockedobject timestamp

1. Oslo uses UTC time to compare two timestamp, this patch
replace the local time in create_at field of lockedobject
with UTC time.

2. Remove unused method _update_lock

Change-Id: Id3de285a217b8651da27dc66246f81206230f4c7
Closes-Bug: #1598542

subject: Fix for tox failing on coverage
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-28 00:46:02.000000000', 'files': ['.coveragerc', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix for tox failing on coverage

Coverage was failing as coverage target was deleting coverage data
before coverage html was run as a side-effect of running coverage
combine. This change fixes it.

Change-Id: I08c974724cc81423f4d440a88d704cfafb75829f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for tox failing on coverage

Coverage was failing as coverage target was deleting coverage data
before coverage html was run as a side-effect of running coverage
combine. This change fixes it.

subject: Fix coverage target
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 21:12:48.000000000', 'files': ['.coveragerc', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix coverage target

Previously the coverage target ended up deleting the coverage data when
the `coverage combine` command ran. This then caused the `coverage html`
command to fail due to lack of data to report on.

Thankfully the fix is simple because pbr is actually handlign all of
this for us behind the scenes. All we need to do is run with the
--coverage flag and make sure the .coveragerc reflects the desired
inclusions and ommisions.

Change-Id: Ide6c7639a19d961e4af27c2c59b036395e2af3ef
'}]
commit_message:
Fix coverage target

Previously the coverage target ended up deleting the coverage data when
the `coverage combine` command ran. This then caused the `coverage html`
command to fail due to lack of data to report on.

Thankfully the fix is simple because pbr is actually handlign all of
this for us behind the scenes. All we need to do is run with the
--coverage flag and make sure the .coveragerc reflects the desired
inclusions and ommisions.

Change-Id: Ide6c7639a19d961e4af27c2c59b036395e2af3ef

subject: Set undercloud_hostname in multinode jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-27 16:07:11.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/deploy.sh'], 'message': 'Set undercloud_hostname in multinode jobs

Infra spawned instances may have some inconsistencies in how their
hostnames are set (some providers uses static network configuration,
some use dhcp, etc).  For consistency, just always set the hostname as
undercloud_hostname in undercloud.conf which will cause the hostname to
be configured via hostnamectl.

Change-Id: Ie41ef3bd493f263b3ac25de65d159682d7ebd767
Closes-Bug: #1606529
'}]
commit_message:
Set undercloud_hostname in multinode jobs

Infra spawned instances may have some inconsistencies in how their
hostnames are set (some providers uses static network configuration,
some use dhcp, etc).  For consistency, just always set the hostname as
undercloud_hostname in undercloud.conf which will cause the hostname to
be configured via hostnamectl.

Change-Id: Ie41ef3bd493f263b3ac25de65d159682d7ebd767
Closes-Bug: #1606529

commit_message:
Remove swift_bytes in slo instead of proxy-server

This seems like a better separation of concerns, and will allow slo to
be smarter about its subrequests if we start storing the computed etag.

commit_message:
add gentoo support to bindep-fallback.txt

This commit adds gentoo support for packages listed in
bindep-fallback.txt.  It should be all of them except zookeeperd (we
don't have that packaged).  A few of these are system things that are
installed by default.  This should be a good starting point we can
work from though.

Change-Id: Ib3e3471d70b963308cc58d30d12fbdd5ff493438

subject: To delete the keypair preparing for update replacement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-07 05:40:57.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/keypair.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_keypair.py'], 'message': "To delete the keypair preparing for update replacement

If the keypair resource is in *_FAILED, to update it will
enter UpdateReplacement, but maybe the keypair exists still
in nova, then we can't recreate the new one, so try to delete
the old one preparing for update replacement.

Change-Id: Ic5a4e1eb4625dcefe5accc484b2c8db7fbb2940d
Closes-Bug: #1597602
"}]
commit_message:
To delete the keypair preparing for update replacement

If the keypair resource is in *_FAILED, to update it will
enter UpdateReplacement, but maybe the keypair exists still
in nova, then we can't recreate the new one, so try to delete
the old one preparing for update replacement.

Change-Id: Ic5a4e1eb4625dcefe5accc484b2c8db7fbb2940d
Closes-Bug: #1597602

commit_message:
Fix opt descripton for cells.py

Removed the following items/sections as per [0]:
- all 'Service which consumes... " sections
- any "Possible values" section if it is only duplicating
the machine readable info in the option definition
- 'Related options' sections that do not contain
any information.

 [0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ConfigOptionsConsistency

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I6f5fa876c0b411e4b06d2a58cf644334d850d674

commit_message:
Move drivers unit tests to unit.volume.drivers directory

This change makes our tests directory cleaner a bit and
helps to find tests faster.

Some of these tests freeze for a long time, so they are skipped.

Related-Bug: #1578986

Change-Id: Ic292b9608cd3d174a2b9b30e7d941e728f32547c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21242, 'name': 'Michael Glaser', 'email': 'michael.glaser@att.com', 'username': 'MikeG451'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 23:06:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': "rt: don't log pci_devices twice when updating resources

By default we update available resources on the compute every
60 seconds. The _report_hypervisor_resource_view method is
logging pci devices twice. On a compute with hundreds of pci
devices this blows up the logs in a short amount of time.

This change removes at least the duplicate pci device logging
but we might want to even consider just not logging these in
each iteration. I've opted to at least push the simple fix for
now.

Change-Id: Id05bfef44b1108dec286486d42516649dd0683e9
Closes-Bug: #1606718
"}]
commit_message:
rt: don't log pci_devices twice when updating resources

By default we update available resources on the compute every
60 seconds. The _report_hypervisor_resource_view method is
logging pci devices twice. On a compute with hundreds of pci
devices this blows up the logs in a short amount of time.

This change removes at least the duplicate pci device logging
but we might want to even consider just not logging these in
each iteration. I've opted to at least push the simple fix for
now.

Change-Id: Id05bfef44b1108dec286486d42516649dd0683e9
Closes-Bug: #1606718

credentials objects from Tempest as well as bumping the

subject: Change LocalUser sql model to eager loading
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-27 18:07:39.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/backends/sql.py'], 'message': 'Change LocalUser sql model to eager loading

This patch changes the LocalUser sql model to eager loading. Subquery
loading is eager loading as the parents are loaded, using one additional
SQL statement, which issues a JOIN to a subquery of the original
statement, for each collection requested.

Closes-Bug: 1606426
Change-Id: I48965676ad6a796115caef5e90974cb617243223
(cherry-picked from: 4b9384dea36755c0dc0256f7392bf8c1e13f6632)
'}]
commit_message:
Change LocalUser sql model to eager loading

This patch changes the LocalUser sql model to eager loading. Subquery
loading is eager loading as the parents are loaded, using one additional
SQL statement, which issues a JOIN to a subquery of the original
statement, for each collection requested.

Closes-Bug: 1606426
Change-Id: I48965676ad6a796115caef5e90974cb617243223
(cherry-picked from: 4b9384dea36755c0dc0256f7392bf8c1e13f6632)

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-07-26 16:24:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/trunk/callbacks.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/trunk/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/plugin.py'], 'message': "Add notifications for trunk CRUD and standardize payload

Registry notifications should be added for trunk create/update/delete,
and SDN controllers as subscribers will need more callbacks as PRECOMMIT
events.

A standardized notification payload will consist of the following:
- context
- trunk_id
- current_trunk
- original_trunk
- subports

This standardized payload will be used in all trunk-related
notifications (trunk create/update/delete and subport add/remove) and
represents the maximum possible amount of information that can be given
in order to future-proof them.

As a bug fix, AFTER_REMOVE event on subport shouldn't be called
during the db transaction, but after the db commit.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Change-Id: Ic1f44fa53cf9f10bd029ea47824e8ba91a8ab485
Co-Authored-By: Isaku Yamahata <isaku.yamahata@intel.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add notifications for trunk CRUD and standardize payload

Registry notifications should be added for trunk create/update/delete,
and SDN controllers as subscribers will need more callbacks as PRECOMMIT
events.

A standardized notification payload will consist of the following:
- context
- trunk_id
- current_trunk
- original_trunk
- subports

This standardized payload will be used in all trunk-related
notifications (trunk create/update/delete and subport add/remove) and
represents the maximum possible amount of information that can be given
in order to future-proof them.

As a bug fix, AFTER_REMOVE event on subport shouldn't be called
during the db transaction, but after the db commit.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Change-Id: Ic1f44fa53cf9f10bd029ea47824e8ba91a8ab485
Co-Authored-By: Isaku Yamahata <isaku.yamahata@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add request/response to subunit-describe-calls

Adds new functionality to subunit-describe-calls. Request & Response
headers + body information now included in JSON output. Makes
-o/--output-file parameter optional, if not specified a shortened output
will be created. Changes the -s/--subunit parameter to not allow for data
to be passed in via stdin.

Change-Id: I44c6b7f9adef7e5be2039c7201f17485f2a46077

commit_message:
MySQL OCF action stop, just to stop

Just do stop, if called. Do not report success
from guessing the current state, ensure it stopped
instead.

Closes-bug: #1596434

Change-Id: I97b2e47e8810d53f0455aa8b4852fd76b03ecebc
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: Bump olso.context minimum to 2.6.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 04:59:12.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Bump olso.context minimum to 2.6.0

olso.context 2.6.0 adds a new 'is_admin_project' attribute and keyword
arg to the RequestContext() __init__ method.

As such we need to bump the upper-constraint and global-requirement at
the same time.

Change-Id: If660d3883c8a50fef3ee935404a6bea9f58a0b07
"}]
commit_message:
Bump olso.context minimum to 2.6.0

olso.context 2.6.0 adds a new 'is_admin_project' attribute and keyword
arg to the RequestContext() __init__ method.

As such we need to bump the upper-constraint and global-requirement at
the same time.

Change-Id: If660d3883c8a50fef3ee935404a6bea9f58a0b07

commit_message:
DNM: disable glance v1

Test out disabling glance v1 and configuring nova
to only use glance v2 to make sure we didn't miss
anything on the nova side when adding the glance
v2 support.

This depends on two changes:

1. The nova change that changes the config to use
   glance v2 by default.
2. A tempest change to fix some tests that were using
   the glance v1 client even if v1 was disabled.

Change-Id: I3b09df09bab283d945ffec7dafa56d5bfc7b6363
Depends-On: I91145c53224aee6d20f6ebe8fd8c7ab540b8df46
Depends-On: I1b1dc2911698d4e4d1a2727902ba457688d88752

commit_message:
Add nova-coverage-db to experimental queue

Add nova's coverage job to the experimental queue, so that we can see
how an in-flight patch affects coverage. It was also intentionally left
in the post queue to track progress over time.

Change-Id: I86a16e3dd87f59bad8498f348a30a96fdee0d664

commit_message:
update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Note: this is a clone of mriedem's manila change [1].

[1] I27348462a21daab479d76b24b48e3a4e017504cc

Change-Id: I185c8f80285f2e7b4f3d3d45a2e6a7dd5741bc1d

commit_message:
Add interface port configuration in EMC VNX driver

Add a new list option 'emc_interface_ports' to configure the network
devices that can be used by share servers. And refined managed pools
selection method to use a new utility method.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Id44ca5e3e64b5a540c91119698e5191366cabfc5
Closes-Bug: #1600117

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-06 20:48:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_guest.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_virt_drivers.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/guest.py'], 'message': "libvirt: cleanup Guest.migrate signature

Forcing the caller of the Guest.migrate method to pass params
and know how those are going to be used when calling libvirt's
migrateToURI3 API is a bit messy. The caller should pass in whatever
is needed for call libvirt, and let the Guest object abstract how
it passes those to libvirt.

This changes the Guest.migrate method to remove the 'params' parameter
and force the caller to pass the values in explicitly.

Note there is still an unfortunately tight-coupling wrinkle here between
the guest and the driver (caller) because device_names tells the
guest object whether or not to use migrateToURI3. That's mostly
unavoidable without passing in flags to Guest.migrate or checking
the libvirt version on the host from within the Guest, which is not
something we do today.

Change-Id: I3abade01e2ba49260f49c70704a02e07b810644d
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: cleanup Guest.migrate signature

Forcing the caller of the Guest.migrate method to pass params
and know how those are going to be used when calling libvirt's
migrateToURI3 API is a bit messy. The caller should pass in whatever
is needed for call libvirt, and let the Guest object abstract how
it passes those to libvirt.

This changes the Guest.migrate method to remove the 'params' parameter
and force the caller to pass the values in explicitly.

Note there is still an unfortunately tight-coupling wrinkle here between
the guest and the driver (caller) because device_names tells the
guest object whether or not to use migrateToURI3. That's mostly
unavoidable without passing in flags to Guest.migrate or checking
the libvirt version on the host from within the Guest, which is not
something we do today.

Change-Id: I3abade01e2ba49260f49c70704a02e07b810644d

commit_message:
Update generic-resource-pools for set inventories

In-development work has shown that an additional method is
needed in the resource providers API to allow the setting
of multiple inventories on one resource provider, in one
request.

This has been added as

   PUT /resource_provideres/{uuid}/inventories

with a body of one or more inventories.

Change-Id: I81f1b26579e8c2b1aa4afce3a90979ea7a925008
Blueprint: generic-resource-pools

subject: Confirm container data destroys
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-27 15:44:33.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/lxc-containers-destroy.yml'], 'message': "Confirm container data destroys

Currently running the lxc-containers-destroy playbook will, when
agreed to, destroy all containers and container data across the
entire deployment.

This patch separates the removal of the container from the removal
of the data and includes a prompt to the user to confirm each
option.

The option can be pre-answered through the use of the boolean
variable 'force_containers_data_destroy'.

Change-Id: I70c4819dbe6fc996dd780f205f3e08c300f18591
"}]
commit_message:
Confirm container data destroys

Currently running the lxc-containers-destroy playbook will, when
agreed to, destroy all containers and container data across the
entire deployment.

This patch separates the removal of the container from the removal
of the data and includes a prompt to the user to confirm each
option.

The option can be pre-answered through the use of the boolean
variable 'force_containers_data_destroy'.

Change-Id: I70c4819dbe6fc996dd780f205f3e08c300f18591

subject: go: make a rate limiter for account per disk/server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 19:28:26.000000000', 'files': ['go/objectserver/main.go', 'go/hummingbird/utils.go', 'go/objectserver/main_test.go', 'go/hummingbird/server.go'], 'message': 'go: make a rate limiter for account per disk/server

this will prevent a single account from taking up all
resources to a disk/server. will return a 498 response
to indicate rate limiting.

this also changes the acceptable config values for the limiter.
0 means unlimited. so instead of doing
disk_limit = 20/10000
to not limit by server you can do
disk_limit = 20/0

ps: yes- i have to slow down everything :p

Change-Id: I1fa5037ed548b05fa5668ce188c9b0c8dc63a745
'}]
commit_message:
go: make a rate limiter for account per disk/server

this will prevent a single account from taking up all
resources to a disk/server. will return a 498 response
to indicate rate limiting.

this also changes the acceptable config values for the limiter.
0 means unlimited. so instead of doing
disk_limit = 20/10000
to not limit by server you can do
disk_limit = 20/0

ps: yes- i have to slow down everything :p

Change-Id: I1fa5037ed548b05fa5668ce188c9b0c8dc63a745

commit_message:
Allow ngdetails path to contain '/'

When the "path" portion of a route contains a '/', prevent Angular
from truncating it. This is common if the resource has a complex
key and wants to use '/' as a separator. For example:
/project/ngdns/zone/<zone_id>/recordset/<recordset_id>

Change-Id: I7b4fe1ba2b2f657ccee91de50cc9d5267544b51e
Closes-Bug: 1605670

It's currently possible to supply an empty string for devname, which

that lacks a devname, address, and both product and vendor ids.

Added checks for invalid entries, mainly devname containing
an empty string, only specifying physical_address, and only providing

Added exception/message for these invalid entries.

commit_message:
Verify pci_passthrough_whitelist fields

It's currently possible to supply an empty string for devname, which
should be invalid.  It's also currently possible to have an entry
that lacks a devname, address, and both product and vendor ids.

Added checks for invalid entries, mainly devname containing
an empty string, only specifying physical_address, and only providing
one of the two ids.

Added exception/message for these invalid entries.

Change-Id: Ie4744b111db44fe029fb4739fda7d345f20fb946
Closes-Bug: #1466451

commit_message:
Use PhantomJS (again) instead of Chrome

We had stopped using PhantomJS due to problems in the gate where npm would fail
to load PhantomJS' binary from BitBucket.  There is a patch in project-config that
uses apt to fetch PhantomJS instead, so this patch (following on that one) will use
PhantomJS again, in the hopes that it is better for testing/more reliable than Chrome.

Change-Id: I1c4ba4f496ef286b330ea60e8e442fed91ea66b7
Partial-Bug: 1587698

commit_message:
Add builder for phantomjs and add to npm job

We had stopped using phantomjs for npm testing because it was having
trouble loading from BitBucket when loaded by npm.  However, we can
just install phantomjs onto the system via apt which avoids the
connectivity problems with BitBucket.

Change-Id: Id02793bd2507ad428f59d28ea5c90c4913b42afc
Partial-Bug: 1587698

subject: Introduce TTL for idle connections
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-07-22 10:03:13.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/connection_ttl-2cf0fe6e1ab8c73c.yaml', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/base.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_kafka.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/pool.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'Introduce TTL for idle connections

We can reduce a workload of rabbitmq through implementation
of expiration mechanism for idle connections in the pool with
next properties:

 conn_pool_ttl (default 20 min)
 conn_pool_min_size: the pool size limit for expire() (default 2)

The problem is timeless idle connections in the pool, which can be created
via some single huge workload of RPCServer. One SEND connection is heartbeat
thread + some network activity every n second. So, we can reduce it.

Here is two ways to implement an expiration:

 [1] Create a separated thread for checking expire date of connections
 [2] Make call expire() on pool.get() or pool.put()

The [1] has some threading overhead, but probably insignificant
because the thread can sleep 99% time and wake up every 20 mins (by default).
Anyway current implementation is [2].

Change-Id: Ie8781d10549a044656824ceb78b2fe2e4f7f8b43
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce TTL for idle connections

We can reduce a workload of rabbitmq through implementation
of expiration mechanism for idle connections in the pool with
next properties:

 conn_pool_ttl (default 20 min)
 conn_pool_min_size: the pool size limit for expire() (default 2)

The problem is timeless idle connections in the pool, which can be created
via some single huge workload of RPCServer. One SEND connection is heartbeat
thread + some network activity every n second. So, we can reduce it.

Here is two ways to implement an expiration:

 [1] Create a separated thread for checking expire date of connections
 [2] Make call expire() on pool.get() or pool.put()

The [1] has some threading overhead, but probably insignificant
because the thread can sleep 99% time and wake up every 20 mins (by default).
Anyway current implementation is [2].

Change-Id: Ie8781d10549a044656824ceb78b2fe2e4f7f8b43

commit_message:
Bump global-requirements.txt for Elasticsearch python client to 2.3.0.

Elasticsearch recommends that the version's major numbers match between
Elasticsearch and the Elasticsearch python client [1]. Since we are
bumping Elasticsearch to 2.X, we also need to bump the python client.

[1] https://elasticsearch-py.readthedocs.io/en/master

Change-Id: I9dcc9548f16028807814102467cb71f153a6b1c0

commit_message:
Add retry in VNX driver when DB lock error happened

A DB lock error may be returned for provisioning operation due
to the DB lock on the array was acquired by other operations. This
patch add retry logic in the driver when this error happened.

Change-Id: Ief378bbaff969875ca29c5f3491d01e773ef44b7
Closes-Bug: #1604699

commit_message:
Add support for deleting volumes with associated snapshots

OSC doesn't support deleting volumes with associated snapshots.
This patch provides support for deleting volumes with associated
snapshots by adding an optional argument.

Change-Id: I7e74f251574993ff13a38e508fd2f9debeda8d0a
Closes-Bug: #1589332
Co-Authored-By: Rui Chen <chenrui.momo@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-06 20:16:00.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/backup/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_backup.py'], 'message': 'Fix backup using temp snapshot code path

- Non-disruptive backup using a temp snapshot works in Liberty
but was broken in Mitaka.
- Backup a snapshot directly without creating a temp volume
worked when the feature was first added in Mitaka but was broken
later in Mitaka.

This patch provides a fix as follows:
1. It checks an existing config option backup_use_same_host.
   By default, this option is False.
2. When the backup service starts, it checks the above option. If
   the option is True, the backup service will find volume manager
   on the current node and get volume backends.
3. If the option is True and backup_use_temp_snapshot returns True,
   volume service returns the snapshot to the backup service in
   get_backup_device and backup will be performed using the snapshot.
   Otherwise, the volume will be returned as the backup device and
   the backup will be performed using the volume.

This fix is a Mitaka backport candidate. After this is merged,
we will provide a more complete fix which allows backup using
temp snapshot to happen on a remote node as well and we will
also clean up the code to get volume backends on the backup node.

The unit test test_backup_volume_inuse_temp_snapshot in test_volume.py
is removed. This test was testing backup_volume in
cinder/volume/driver.py, but this code path is not used any more.
Backup now starts in create_backup in backup/manager.py which calls
_run_backup which calls _attach_snapshot in volume/driver.py. The new
test test_create_backup_with_temp_snapshot in test_backup.py tests
the new code path.

Note: The return value is changed for _attach_snapshot() in
volume/driver.py. It now returns a dictionary of attach_info.

Closes-Bug: #1578034
Closes-Bug: #1575886
(cherry picked from commit 763dd8cdc5c48b7771d081dcd8b9e37a8f6c0a71)

Conflicts:
	cinder/backup/manager.py
	cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py

Change-Id: I2e0c115e1dacf9eea73803cdbb1452bfeb56d87c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix backup using temp snapshot code path

- Non-disruptive backup using a temp snapshot works in Liberty
but was broken in Mitaka.
- Backup a snapshot directly without creating a temp volume
worked when the feature was first added in Mitaka but was broken
later in Mitaka.

This patch provides a fix as follows:
1. It checks an existing config option backup_use_same_host.
   By default, this option is False.
2. When the backup service starts, it checks the above option. If
   the option is True, the backup service will find volume manager
   on the current node and get volume backends.
3. If the option is True and backup_use_temp_snapshot returns True,
   volume service returns the snapshot to the backup service in
   get_backup_device and backup will be performed using the snapshot.
   Otherwise, the volume will be returned as the backup device and
   the backup will be performed using the volume.

This fix is a Mitaka backport candidate. After this is merged,
we will provide a more complete fix which allows backup using
temp snapshot to happen on a remote node as well and we will
also clean up the code to get volume backends on the backup node.

The unit test test_backup_volume_inuse_temp_snapshot in test_volume.py
is removed. This test was testing backup_volume in
cinder/volume/driver.py, but this code path is not used any more.
Backup now starts in create_backup in backup/manager.py which calls
_run_backup which calls _attach_snapshot in volume/driver.py. The new
test test_create_backup_with_temp_snapshot in test_backup.py tests
the new code path.

Note: The return value is changed for _attach_snapshot() in
volume/driver.py. It now returns a dictionary of attach_info.

Closes-Bug: #1578034
Closes-Bug: #1575886
(cherry picked from commit 763dd8cdc5c48b7771d081dcd8b9e37a8f6c0a71)

Conflicts:
	cinder/backup/manager.py
	cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py

Change-Id: I2e0c115e1dacf9eea73803cdbb1452bfeb56d87c

OpenStack Infra nodes are run in different clouds, and they have
different DNS configurations. Some of them have 'search' and 'domain'
parameters in /etc/resolv.conf and it prevents Puppet to resolve
correctly the actual fqdn and hostnames, used by Facter.

commit_message:
multinode: cleanup resolv.conf

OpenStack Infra nodes are run in different clouds, and they have
different DNS configurations. Some of them have 'search' and 'domain'
parameters in /etc/resolv.conf and it prevents Puppet to resolve
correctly the actual fqdn and hostnames, used by Facter.
This is a workaround to run Puppet in OpenStack Infra CI.

Change-Id: I3ad1daf7b208ad28f2eb963b3c57a6d052749169
Closes-Bug: #1606529

commit_message:
Extend test plan and results for OpenStack networking

Add test cases to measure throughput for cases when instances are
located on the same compute node.

Change-Id: I50156b6b0ac4c66fd3481e897785bcf771f8cf55

commit_message:
Add third party gating to quickstart

* add 'dlrn-gate' job type to roles-deploy.sh
* add option to disable the gating repo on injection
* fix provision tags in the roles based playbook
* add gating_repo_enabled option to support upgrade jobs
* fix condition for extracting the overcloud image during injection

Change-Id: I705649bbca18ef87b235964aab049c8d250ba31c

Gnocchi 2.1 introduces a change where legacy resource types
needed by ceilometer are not created by default. Instead a
new flag is exposed to create these. We should use this by
default. Note that this is an optional flag and is only
needed if you want to create legacy resource types.

Change-Id: I95ccccb40ce4a8319d0776c4d62c2890cf1fd970
Closes-bug: #1592449
(cherry picked from commit 67cb6c703eaa986cbb2b9ca4cac4c9fa48c7ef60)
'}]
commit_message:
Use create-legacy-resource-types during gnocchi-upgrade

Gnocchi 2.1 introduces a change where legacy resource types
needed by ceilometer are not created by default. Instead a
new flag is exposed to create these. We should use this by
default. Note that this is an optional flag and is only
needed if you want to create legacy resource types.

Change-Id: I95ccccb40ce4a8319d0776c4d62c2890cf1fd970
Closes-bug: #1592449
(cherry picked from commit 67cb6c703eaa986cbb2b9ca4cac4c9fa48c7ef60)

commit_message:
RPC server side for trunk driver

Introduces RPC framework for trunk plugin.

It is left up to the driver to register
the callbacks.

Includes the implementation of one rpc callback:
get_trunk_by_port_id().

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Change-Id: I3da636494c492d3667036eedebba49aed8ebadee

commit_message:
Fix handler case where no old process is found

In cases where no old process was found, the shell
command was exiting 1 and causing the handler to report
a failure.

Change-Id: Ic1701f7495abdec713c05d2c95bfdd1e7b1ff73d
Closes-Bug: #1603136

commit_message:
Run OpenStack db_sync commands at every puppet run

Run all db_sync commands for OpenStack services at every puppet run.
So undercloud gets automatically updated everytime we run Puppet.

Change-Id: Ia5dd5f66049ef032c63872a56c56f4e36dd75d1b

The VIOS type element can be running true Client Network Adapters (VEAs
without additional trunk adapters) on it.  The heal and optimize code
should take these adapters into account.

This change set updates some of the utility methods to account for VIOS
types.  It also updates the heal and optimize code to take these VEAs

Change-Id: If21246b1d9c140a9b97201ced95f578a86b5c62d

commit_message:
Support VIOS CNAs

The VIOS type element can be running true Client Network Adapters (VEAs
without additional trunk adapters) on it.  The heal and optimize code
should take these adapters into account.

This change set updates some of the utility methods to account for VIOS
types.  It also updates the heal and optimize code to take these VEAs
into account for the whole system (LPARs and VIOSes).

Change-Id: If21246b1d9c140a9b97201ced95f578a86b5c62d

commit_message:
Improve consistency in xenserver

Removed sections that are no longer required [1].
Added default values to the description.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ConfigOptionsConsistency

Co-Authored-By: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I89f245527f8f8a99d270ca903d0146e0e8f32b12

subject: Enable the use of a package manager cache
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-07-27 11:03:53.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/vars/configs/haproxy_config.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/haproxy-package-cache-backend-da096228387bc1f4.yaml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml', 'playbooks/repo-server.yml'], 'message': 'Enable the use of a package manager cache

This change instructs package managers to use a proxy connecting
through the repo server instead of going directly to the online
repository. This should speedup deployments by caching packages
closer to the environment.

Change-Id: I91d7320bb33996eb61516927cb35eff3b0ecaa79
Depends-On: I78b2fba6a1f294751bd7098513060015cb41300c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Enable the use of a package manager cache

This change instructs package managers to use a proxy connecting
through the repo server instead of going directly to the online
repository. This should speedup deployments by caching packages
closer to the environment.

Change-Id: I91d7320bb33996eb61516927cb35eff3b0ecaa79
Depends-On: I78b2fba6a1f294751bd7098513060015cb41300c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-26 20:01:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/baremetal_nodes.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py', 'nova/conf/ironic.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_client_wrapper.py'], 'message': "Remove deprecated ironic.api_version config option

The option was deprecated in mitaka:

26c69a6a62a138ccdb88ecc5bf75330a04e5de0b

Some parts of the code were still using it, but it's
effectively not used since that change in mitaka and
we can just hard-code it when getting the ironic client,
which also doesn't use it:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-ironicclient/tree/ironicclient/client.py?h=1.1.0#n58

There is no release note for this change. Since the option was
made useless in Mitaka there isn't really a point in notifiying
people that a vestigial config option is now gone.

Change-Id: If594ae1a367b20db9b2d65188d65a0c6ab09789b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove deprecated ironic.api_version config option

The option was deprecated in mitaka:

26c69a6a62a138ccdb88ecc5bf75330a04e5de0b

Some parts of the code were still using it, but it's
effectively not used since that change in mitaka and
we can just hard-code it when getting the ironic client,
which also doesn't use it:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-ironicclient/tree/ironicclient/client.py?h=1.1.0#n58

There is no release note for this change. Since the option was
made useless in Mitaka there isn't really a point in notifiying
people that a vestigial config option is now gone.

Change-Id: If594ae1a367b20db9b2d65188d65a0c6ab09789b

'doc/source/stig-notes/V-38609.rst', 'doc/source/stig-notes/V-58901_developer.rst'], 'message': "Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test\n\nThe 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs\ntarget in the 'linters' chain of tests.\n\nFixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also\nincluded in the patch.\n\nChange-Id: I80c2ce387e59a30c34bf2252a54037c00b420380\n"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: I80c2ce387e59a30c34bf2252a54037c00b420380

subject: Ensure that container config/command order is correct
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 14:35:38.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/container_create.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure that container config/command order is correct

This patch ensures that the config application and command execution
are completed in the same order as the lxc_container module.

This ensures that any bind-mounts to the host can have the container
directory created prior to the implementation of the drive mount.

With these tasks in the reverse order, the container cache would have
to have all the required directories in place already.

Change-Id: Ib8c289da2f4eb2d0e52b2d75376dd73dd9b2a650
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that container config/command order is correct

This patch ensures that the config application and command execution
are completed in the same order as the lxc_container module.

This ensures that any bind-mounts to the host can have the container
directory created prior to the implementation of the drive mount.

With these tasks in the reverse order, the container cache would have
to have all the required directories in place already.

subject: Add jira, jira client library for JIRA issue tracker
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-27 17:07:06.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add jira, jira client library for JIRA issue tracker

This dependency is required for openstack/monasca-notification.
This is used for automatically creating issue in Issue tracker

1. Is this library actively maintained?
   Yes

2. Is the library good code?
   Yes

3. Is the library python3 compatible?
   Yes

4) Is the library licence compatible?
   Yes, BSD

5) Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
   Yes, It is hosted in pypi

6) Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
   in global-requirements.txt?
   No

7) Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
   infrastructure setup?
   Required for monasca-notification JIRA plugin.

Change-Id: I61b6ae8438f43f95df11fe5db4c868324259ff7e
'}]
commit_message:
Add jira, jira client library for JIRA issue tracker

This dependency is required for openstack/monasca-notification.
This is used for automatically creating issue in Issue tracker

1. Is this library actively maintained?
   Yes

2. Is the library good code?
   Yes

3. Is the library python3 compatible?
   Yes

4) Is the library licence compatible?
   Yes, BSD

5) Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
   Yes, It is hosted in pypi

6) Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
   in global-requirements.txt?
   No

7) Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
   infrastructure setup?
   Required for monasca-notification JIRA plugin.

Change-Id: I61b6ae8438f43f95df11fe5db4c868324259ff7e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-26 19:31:12.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/deprecate-nova-manage-network-commands-212726e67bffdfc4.yaml', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': 'Deprecate the nova-manage commands that rely on nova-network

nova-network is deprecated. The 2.36 microversion makes the
network REST APIs fail with a 404. And the network CLIs/APIs
in python-novaclient are being deprecated. So we should also
deprecate the nova-manage commands that use nova-network.

Change-Id: I5efeb5e5c552064028ae0dea5ce5314c5d92cf0e
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate the nova-manage commands that rely on nova-network

nova-network is deprecated. The 2.36 microversion makes the
network REST APIs fail with a 404. And the network CLIs/APIs
in python-novaclient are being deprecated. So we should also
deprecate the nova-manage commands that use nova-network.

Change-Id: I5efeb5e5c552064028ae0dea5ce5314c5d92cf0e

subject: Use a lower number of the workers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-27 08:37:45.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/murano/templates/murano.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/nova/templates/nova.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/neutron/templates/neutron.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/glance/templates/glance-registry.conf.j2', 'ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible/roles/cinder/templates/cinder.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/glance/templates/glance-api.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/heat/templates/heat.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Use a lower number of the workers

Use a lower number of workers rather than the default value, which is
equal to the number of the cpu. Otherwise, in a multi cpu environment,
the number of the processes will very high.

In this PS, we use min(5, << number of cpu >>) as the default worker
count.

Closes-Bug: #1582254
Change-Id: I1c32cf0db794b43b8fb8be18f39190422ca5846f
'}]
commit_message:
Use a lower number of the workers

Use a lower number of workers rather than the default value, which is
equal to the number of the cpu. Otherwise, in a multi cpu environment,
the number of the processes will very high.

In this PS, we use min(5, << number of cpu >>) as the default worker
count.

Closes-Bug: #1582254
Change-Id: I1c32cf0db794b43b8fb8be18f39190422ca5846f

commit_message:
WIP: Use neutron network API in neutron security group driver

In an effort to wrap the Neutron network API calls and handle
global errors (unauthorized, connection failures, etc), we
should have the Neutron security group driver in Nova use the
Neutron network API for existing APIs like listing ports.

We'll have to make a decision about whether or not to move the
security group client calls from the security group driver into
the Neutron network API so all of the calls to Neutron happen
through the network API.

Change-Id: I33509c14f327649b80a829d5332a10b1ca7f15a7
Related-Bug: #1571722

commit_message:
NetApp: Report hybrid aggregates in share stats

NetApp cDOT controllers can mix SSDs and spinning disks
in the same aggregate, where the SSDs are used for a
cache.  This commit reports the hybrid aggregate attribute
as well as the aggregate name to the scheduler for each
pool for use in extra specs matching.

Implements: blueprint netapp-report-cdot-hybrid-aggrs-manila
Change-Id: Iaa0bcd79789449f977b48f1de2adf997c936db61

commit_message:
Fix wrong declaration in Scheduler's base driver

In Scheduler's base driver host_passes_filters method declaration does
not match the actual method that we are using in the code -in
filter_scheduler-.

This patch syncs base method declaration with filter_scheduler's.

Change-Id: I227648809f61ef3ca450457576e53a24e3628db4

'}]
commit_message:
specs_matcher: Allow passing custom op_methods

This allows the caller of specs_matcher.match() to pass a custom list of
op_methods to use. One example use of this is to pass only
integer-related methods to be used for matching values that can only be
integers.

Change-Id: I696e41c2e9a3763497d495b95929664309fd02f9

subject: Eagerly load passwords for local users
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3031, 'name': 'Sam Morrison', 'email': 'sorrison@gmail.com', 'username': 'sorrison'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 18338, 'name': 'Ron De Rose', 'email': 'ronald.de.rose@intel.com', 'username': 'derosenet'}, {'_account_id': 22213, 'name': 'OSIC Performance Bot', 'email': 'openstackkeystoneperformance@gmail.com', 'username': 'openstackkeystoneperformance'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-27 14:31:47.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/backends/sql_model.py'], 'message': 'Eagerly load passwords for local users

As part of user list, passwords are fetched from the database.
Passwords are in a separate table.

Before it made N queries for N passwords. With the change, 1 query
is made.

Tests made on my local instance:
Before: API call to list 10k users took 15s and O(N) queries.
After: API call to list 10k users takes 3s and O(1) queries.

Change-Id: I2a3d4cfe6e7a527c3a0b2e0fa82e4090a3619868
Closes-Bug: 1606426
'}]
commit_message:
Eagerly load passwords for local users

As part of user list, passwords are fetched from the database.
Passwords are in a separate table.

Before it made N queries for N passwords. With the change, 1 query
is made.

Tests made on my local instance:
Before: API call to list 10k users took 15s and O(N) queries.
After: API call to list 10k users takes 3s and O(1) queries.

Change-Id: I2a3d4cfe6e7a527c3a0b2e0fa82e4090a3619868
Closes-Bug: 1606426

subject: Fix out-dated requests and urllib3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 22:01:04.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix out-dated requests and urllib3

The repo build server sometimes includes old versions
of the requests and urllib3 python packages.  These
old versions may be due to outdated system libs.

This patch instructs pip to install requests and urllib3
to the latest version on the repo-build host.

Change-Id: I78dd9b1430f13e23fe153b162ef4aa38b216c279
'}]
commit_message:
Fix out-dated requests and urllib3

The repo build server sometimes includes old versions
of the requests and urllib3 python packages.  These
old versions may be due to outdated system libs.

This patch instructs pip to install requests and urllib3
to the latest version on the repo-build host.

Change-Id: I78dd9b1430f13e23fe153b162ef4aa38b216c279

commit_message:
Table actions improvement

Some tables need filter actions for convenience, some create buttons
need "plus" icons, some delete buttons have to be placed at the end
of list for consistency with the rest of UI tables.
This patch fullfills all these needs. Also, all filter actions are
replaced with the very same action from Horizon.

Change-Id: Ie4efd6f10d2344dcf9cd8ad92460e6cd1ed7332b

node-fetch utilizes Node.js standard library to work, so it

Change-Id: Idc8d18021a3226fb8339c99e3009dc53cbc15b2a
'}]
commit_message:
Switch back from node-fetch to isomorphic-fetch

node-fetch utilizes Node.js standard library to work, so it
cannot be used in browsers. So we need to switch back to
isomorphic-fetch which works both in browsers and Node.js.

Change-Id: Idc8d18021a3226fb8339c99e3009dc53cbc15b2a

subject: Fix override of ANSIBLE_PACKAGE variable
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 538, 'name': 'Major Hayden', 'email': 'major@mhtx.net', 'username': 'rackerhacker'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 14805, 'name': 'Jimmy McCrory', 'email': 'jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com', 'username': 'jimmy-mccrory'}, {'_account_id': 18784, 'name': 'Michael Carden', 'email': 'mike.carden@gmail.com', 'username': 'mcarden'}, {'_account_id': 22042, 'name': 'Chris Smart', 'email': 'distroguy@gmail.com', 'username': 'csmart'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-27 11:03:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-docs/scripts.rst', 'scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': 'Fix override of ANSIBLE_PACKAGE variable

The initialisation of the ANSIBLE_PACKAGE variable in bootstrap-ansible
should be overridden by any existing environment variable of the same
name, however it is incorrectly looking for "ANSIBLE_RELEASE." This means
that any attempt to override the Ansible version will be ignored.

This patch fixes it so that the script looks for a variable of the same
name, "ANSIBLE_PACKAGE," and also updates the documentation.

Related to commit:
88ae508e0f95 "Install Ansible from pypi instead of from a git clone."

Change-Id: I5cf40ea855f05073fbe568cd9839dbd5134e19bf
'}]
commit_message:
Fix override of ANSIBLE_PACKAGE variable

The initialisation of the ANSIBLE_PACKAGE variable in bootstrap-ansible
should be overridden by any existing environment variable of the same
name, however it is incorrectly looking for "ANSIBLE_RELEASE." This means
that any attempt to override the Ansible version will be ignored.

This patch fixes it so that the script looks for a variable of the same
name, "ANSIBLE_PACKAGE," and also updates the documentation.

Related to commit:
88ae508e0f95 "Install Ansible from pypi instead of from a git clone."

Change-Id: I5cf40ea855f05073fbe568cd9839dbd5134e19bf

Change-Id: Ie25e1eb3da66cc627d93af585b0893469d6a7b2e

commit_message:
Add YAML configuration parsing

While discussing I7539fdeada14a73ae4e18a125bb0e3947f08e8d1 Doug and
Harry realized that it would be much better if some of these values
could be specified in a config file, whether INI or YAML.

This adds a simple function to allow options to be specified in the
config file named "config.yml" in the --rel-notes-dir.

Change-Id: Ie25e1eb3da66cc627d93af585b0893469d6a7b2e

commit_message:
Remove monasca-analytics

The monasca-analytics py27 job performs extra steps[1] beyond what is
specified in the PTI, which makes dealing with it in a standardized
manner difficult.  PTI compliance is required for inclusion in
OpenStack.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/jenkins/jobs/monasca.yaml#n147

Change-Id: I6e4c73a1f9926ac2b8c744bead0b267cb489e441

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-05-23 09:07:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/conductor/tasks/live_migrate.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/tasks/test_live_migrate.py'], 'message': 'raise exception ComputeHostNotFound if host is not found

When performing a live migration,I passed a wrong host parameter,
and then I got a wrong result like this:
"Compute service of host-1 is unavailable at this time".
I thought the compute service stopped, but the fact was I passed
a host id instead of a host name,therefore it could not find the host.

In order to distinguish the error "host not found" from the error
"service not available", I think we should raise a different exception
ComputeHostNotFound instead of ComputeServiceUnavailable.

This patch we will return more accurate error msg for live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1538837
Change-Id: I6ad377147070f85b9b1d5a1d1be459e890e02bcc
'}]
commit_message:
raise exception ComputeHostNotFound if host is not found

When performing a live migration,I passed a wrong host parameter,
and then I got a wrong result like this:
"Compute service of host-1 is unavailable at this time".
I thought the compute service stopped, but the fact was I passed
a host id instead of a host name,therefore it could not find the host.

In order to distinguish the error "host not found" from the error
"service not available", I think we should raise a different exception
ComputeHostNotFound instead of ComputeServiceUnavailable.

This patch we will return more accurate error msg for live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1538837
Change-Id: I6ad377147070f85b9b1d5a1d1be459e890e02bcc

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-07-27 06:50:05.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install.rst', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn_scheduler.py', 'networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/functional/base.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_ovsdb_monitor.py', 'networking_ovn/common/constants.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovn_api.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/common/config.py', 'devstack/local.conf.sample', 'networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py', 'devstack/lib/networking-ovn', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn_scheduler.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/fakes.py'], 'message': 'Add OVN L3 Router Scheduler

This patch provides the infrastructure for the OVN L3 to schedule
the router gateway port. The OVN hypervisor administrator can
set aside certain hypervisors to be used for scheduling router
gateway ports. This is the corresponding WIP patch at the moment:
http://openvswitch.org/pipermail/dev/2016-June/073285.html

For now it is assumed that any hypervisor/chassis can host a router
gateway port.

There are 2 types of schedulers defined at the moment
(1) RandomChoice
(2) LeastLoaded

The Chassis (add/delete/update) event is used to schedule router
gateway ports which have not been bound to any chassis.

A future patch will add functional tests.

Change-Id: I83fb561cee642b90c4de41bb8e472f47fa807191
Related-Bug: 1514995
'}]
commit_message:
Add OVN L3 Router Scheduler

This patch provides the infrastructure for the OVN L3 to schedule
the router gateway port. The OVN hypervisor administrator can
set aside certain hypervisors to be used for scheduling router
gateway ports. This is the corresponding WIP patch at the moment:
http://openvswitch.org/pipermail/dev/2016-June/073285.html

For now it is assumed that any hypervisor/chassis can host a router
gateway port.

There are 2 types of schedulers defined at the moment
(1) RandomChoice
(2) LeastLoaded

The Chassis (add/delete/update) event is used to schedule router
gateway ports which have not been bound to any chassis.

A future patch will add functional tests.

Change-Id: I83fb561cee642b90c4de41bb8e472f47fa807191
Related-Bug: 1514995

commit_message:
Changing ovn plugin to ml2 mechanism driver

openstack/networking-ovn is no more a core plugin. A resent revamping
made it to a ml2 mechanism driver. This patch addresses this change.

Fixes-bug: #1600790
Change-Id: Ie8f8653ed6eefd7e278862de1293e2a2fc206c66

The log message printed if the service is disabled when retrieving
manageable snapshots uses resource name 'volume' instead of 'snapshot'.
This patch sets the resource kwarg to 'snapshot' while calling the

commit_message:
Fix log message when service is disabled

The log message printed if the service is disabled when retrieving
manageable snapshots uses resource name 'volume' instead of 'snapshot'.
This patch sets the resource kwarg to 'snapshot' while calling the
utility function '_get_service_by_host' to fix this.

Change-Id: I13610ef6a0ec6193d1b3b80d3c2ebcdcb3d6134c
Closes-bug: #1605551

subject: Replace minified bootstrap & jquery js and css
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-27 10:03:29.000000000', 'files': ['openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/static/js/jquery-1.11.3.js', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/static/js/bootstrap.js', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/script_footer.html', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/css.html', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/static/js/bootstrap.min.js', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/static/css/bootstrap.css', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/static/css/bootstrap.min.css'], 'message': "Replace minified bootstrap & jquery js and css

The bootstrap.min.css and boostrap.min.js are considered source-less
non-free files by downstream distributions like Debian, Ubuntu,
RHEL, Gentoo and SuSE. We therefore can't ship that in openstackdocstheme.

This patch replaces the .min.css and .min.js by their non-minified
equivalent, so we get a less non-free theme.

Note that this isn't it, as there's some external references to CDN,
which is a privacy breach: we shouldn't allow making queries to external
resources in our docs. That's not what one would expect when browsing a
local hard drive. This will be addressed in a later patch.

Change-Id: I7410f3356731e67ce4304c0e0c43565f8139f361
"}]
commit_message:
Replace minified bootstrap & jquery js and css

The bootstrap.min.css and boostrap.min.js are considered source-less
non-free files by downstream distributions like Debian, Ubuntu,
RHEL, Gentoo and SuSE. We therefore can't ship that in openstackdocstheme.

This patch replaces the .min.css and .min.js by their non-minified
equivalent, so we get a less non-free theme.

Note that this isn't it, as there's some external references to CDN,
which is a privacy breach: we shouldn't allow making queries to external
resources in our docs. That's not what one would expect when browsing a
local hard drive. This will be addressed in a later patch.

Change-Id: I7410f3356731e67ce4304c0e0c43565f8139f361

commit_message:
Use scp to copy deploy.env to subnodes

The previous ssh command was not creating deploy.env properly due to
misquoting, causing all DIB* related variables to not be set during the
bootstrap-overcloud-full.sh script. Just use scp instead.

Change-Id: I1951704a7184b7662d7a60c7ae4c8fa8eac0b3f6
Closes-Bug: #1605596

subject: Fix bug in background sending
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-26 09:29:56.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometermiddleware/swift.py'], 'message': "Fix bug in background sending

Thread's daemon property needs to be set from calling thread.
Ensure thread is alive whenever we add an event to the queue (for some reason, this is not the case for the first event when this is deployed in a swift proxy setup).

Change-Id: I9a8fad8036a0887653d2ad5f99f6b5b1b953c2db
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bug in background sending

Thread's daemon property needs to be set from calling thread.
Ensure thread is alive whenever we add an event to the queue (for some reason, this is not the case for the first event when this is deployed in a swift proxy setup).

Change-Id: I9a8fad8036a0887653d2ad5f99f6b5b1b953c2db

commit_message:
Add MultiStrOpt for scheduler_available_filters

scheduler_available_filters option defines filter classes made available to
the nova scheduler. This parameter can be used multiple times or it can be
set as array value.
It is helpful when owner want to add to nova scheduler external filters.

Co-Authored-By: Daniel Pawlik <daniel.pawlik@corp.ovh.com>

Change-Id: I6be7bb4cea1906bd98c513bd2d01153e4643e3ac
Closes-Bug: #1591998
